question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first case mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Procurement of 18 critical spares and one set of OB spares\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the estimated value of the procurement of 18 critical spares and one set of OB spares?

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the total saving achieved in the re-engining case?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Ministry of Civil Aviation in the process of setting up?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Rajiv Gandhi National Aviation University (RGNAU) to cater to the growing educational and training requirements of the Civil Aviation sector.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main objective of setting up the RGNAU?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To create and disseminate knowledge that facilitates progress and excellence in the field of aviation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Union Cabinet approved setting up the RGNAU as?

question_answer_pairs.answer: Both Houses of Parliament.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Permission to travel by private airlines on the sectors where Air India does not operate its flight.\"\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference document mentioned in this memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference document is the Department of Expenditure's D.O. letter No.19024/1/2016-E.IV, dated 23rd May, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which sectors or routes are mentioned in the memorandum where private airlines can be used?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The memorandum mentions Jodhpur-Jaipur, Jaipur-Udaipur-Jaipur, Jaipur-Bikaner-Jaipur, Mangalore-Bengaluru-Mangalore, which have not been mentioned in the list of sectors on which general/blanket approval has been accorded by the Ministry of Civil Aviation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key issue that this memorandum is addressing?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The key issue is that the request for general/blanket relaxation for the mentioned sectors has been examined, and it has been decided that in any sector where Air India is not operating, the officers are permitted to travel by airlines other than Air India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the signatory of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is signed by Chandra Kishore Shukla, Under Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The memorandum is dated 05.06.2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Permission to travel by private airlines on the sectors where Air India does not operate its flight.\"\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference document mentioned in this memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference document is the Department of Expenditure's D.O. letter No.19024/1/2016-E.IV, dated 23rd May, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which sectors or routes are mentioned in the memorandum where private airlines can be used?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The memorandum mentions the sectors of Jodhpur-Jaipur, Jaipur-Udaipur-Jaipur, Jaipur-Bikaner-Jaipur, Mangalore-Bengaluru-Mangalore, which have not been mentioned in the list of sectors on which general/blanket approval has been accorded by the Ministry of Civil Aviation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key issue that this memorandum is addressing?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The memorandum is addressing the request for general/blanket relaxation to travel by private airlines on the sectors where Air India does not operate its flights.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has examined this request for general/blanket relaxation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The request has been examined in this ministry.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the conclusion or decision regarding the request for general/blanket relaxation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been decided that in any sector, where Air India is not operating, the officers are permitted to travel by airlines other than Air India and no separate approval/exemption is required for this purpose.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is issued by Chandra Kishore Shukla, Under Secretary to the Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is the engagement of a consultant by the Ministry of Civil Aviation for the work relating to setting up of the Rajiv Gandhi National Aviation University.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the Rajiv Gandhi National Aviation University be set up?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The university will be set up at Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Uran Akademi (IGRUA) Complex, Raebareli, U.P.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the expected outcome of setting up this university?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The university is expected to become a centre of excellence in the field of Civil Aviation education.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What services of an officer who retired at the level of Dy
question_answer_pairs.answer: The services of an officer who retired at the level of Dy. Secretary/Director to Govt. of India are required to assist the Ministry in the implementation of this project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for engagement as a consultant?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The details including eligibility criteria, TOR etc. are available on the Ministry's website: www.civilaviation.gov.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the last date for receipt of applications?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The last date for receipt of applications is 28th April 2014 upto 5:00 P.M.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen to applications received after the due date and time?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Applications received after the due date and time will not be considered.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document type is RBI/2022-23/82 and the reference number is DOR. SOG (SPE).REC.No 53/13.03.000/2022-23.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated July 06, 2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the document addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to All Scheduled Commercial Banks (including Regional Rural Banks), All Small Finance Banks, All Local Area Banks, All Payment Banks, and All Primary (Urban) Co-operative Banks/ DCCBs/State Cooperative Banks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Master Direction on Interest Rate on Deposits - Foreign Currency (Non-resident) Accounts (Banks) Scheme [FCNR(B)] and Non-Resident (External) Rupee (NRE) Deposit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide instructions regarding interest rates on FCNR(B) deposits.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can the reader find the instructions on interest rates on FCNR(B) deposits?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The instructions are contained in Section 19 of the Master Direction (MD) on Interest Rate on Deposits dated March 03, 2016.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When do the interest rate changes mentioned in the document take effect?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The interest rate changes are advised to take effect from July 07, 2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the period for which the interest rate changes are applicable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The interest rate changes are applicable for incremental FCNR(B) deposits mobilized by banks for the period until October 31, 2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the interest rates on NRE deposits be affected?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In terms of Section 15 (d) and Section 14 (d) of the above-mentioned MDs, interest rates on NRE deposits shall not be higher than those offered by the banks on comparable domestic term deposits.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the temporary withdrawal of the relaxation on interest rates offered on incremental NRE deposits?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The said relaxation shall be temporarily withdrawn with effect from July 07, 2022, for the period until October 31, 2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document referring to when it mentions \"the above-mentioned MDs\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is referring to the Master Direction (MD) on Interest Rate on Deposits dated March 03, 2016, and the Master Direction (MD) on Interest Rate on Deposits dated May 12, 2016.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the temporary withdrawal of the relaxation on interest rates offered on incremental NRE deposits?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to align the interest rates on NRE deposits with those offered on comparable domestic term deposits.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The addressees include All Scheduled Commercial Banks (including Regional Rural Banks), All Small Finance Banks, All Local Area Banks, All Payment Banks, and All Primary (Urban) Co-operative Banks/ DCCBs/State Cooperative Banks.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide instructions regarding interest rates on FCNR(B) and NRE deposits.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The interest rate changes are advised to take effect from July 07, 2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Sri M.Nagabhushana Sarma,M.Sc.,Ed.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of the document?
What is the date of the document?
What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: APREIS, Hyd - Accounts - Payment of Salaries to the Full Time Guest Teachers on par with CRTs on the 1st of Every Month - Orders - Issued.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference mentioned in the document?

This Office prcs.Rc.10271/C3-1/98, dt.31.07.1998,Secy,APREIS,Hyd. 2. This office procs.Rc.No:5420/A1-2/2013-16,dt.7/8/2016,Secy,APREIS,Hyd. 3. Letter No.02/APRS/Gani/16, Dt.23.09.2016, from the Principal,APRS(B), Gandipally, SPSR Nellore dist. 4. Letter No.07/APRS(G)/in/16, Dt.24.09.2016, from the Principal,APRS(B), Chelakurpet, Guntur dist.\n7. What is the key point mentioned in the reference 2nd and 3rd cited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As per the orders issued in the reference 2nd cited, all the Full time Guest Teacher service has been utilizing on par with CRT teachers with supervised studies and night study duties and salaries are being paid according to the increase after passing the bills from Head Office causing delay in payment by two months.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the permission being requested in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Permission may be accorded to claim the Salaries of Full Time Guest Teachers along with CRTs immediately so as to overcome the above problems.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What instructions have been issued through the proceedings cited in the reference 1st?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This office has issued instructions through the proceedings dt.31.7.1998 wherein issued orders permitting all the Principals to claim the part-time teacher's wages immediately after completion of the month from the Imprest Contingent bill.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the office enhanced as per the reference 2nd cited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As per the Resolutions of the Board of Governors, this office has enhanced the existing remuneration to all the Guest faculty working in A.P.R.E. Institutions on par with Contract personnel.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for the delay in payment of salaries to the Full Time Guest Teachers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The delay in payment is due to the fact that the bills have been passing after completion of the month they worked and payment is being made after passing and receiving the payment from Head Office i.e. in the next month.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction given regarding the payment of salary if a Guest Teacher is absent or leave?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If any Guest Teacher is absent or leave the payment of salary will be deducted and 10 Pay will be remitted to the Society.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will be mentioned in the bill if there is any long absence of Full Time Guest Teacher?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If any long absence of Full Time Guest Teacher the same will be mentioned in the bill and will avoid the payment while submitting bill itself so as to avoid U.P. Pay for several times.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does this may help the Full Time Guest Teachers to work with Happy atmosphere?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This may help the Full Time Guest Teachers to work hard with Happy atmosphere and interest without difference with regular CRT and Full Time Guest Teachers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the contingent bill mentioned in the reference 1st cited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Imprest Contingent bill of the Society along with Salary bill of regular employees.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The existing remuneration to all the Guest faculty working in A.P.R.E. Institutions on par with Contract personnel has been enhanced.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: To inform that some of the Circle/Unit Offices are not maintaining attendance strictly and some offices have not yet installed Biometric Devices\n

file_name: img_fp_Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs_Guidelines-recovery-section-79-CGST-Act-2017.png

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number mentioned in the image?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Instruction No. 01/2022-GST.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated 7th January, 2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the document is Guidelines for recovery proceedings under the provisions of section 79 of the CGST Act, 2017 in cases covered under explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017-Reg.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the document addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to The Principal Chief Commissioners / Chief Commissioners / Principal Commissioners / Commissioners of Central Tax (All) and The Principal Directors General / Directors General (All).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to clarify that \"self-assessed tax\" shall include the tax payable in respect of outward supplies, the details of which have been furnished under section 37, but not included in the return furnished under section 39.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provision mentioned in the document is sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017 provide?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017 provides that notwithstanding anything contained in section 73 or section 74 of the Act, where any amount of self-assessed tax in accordance with a return furnished under section 39 remains unpaid, either wholly or partly, or any amount of interest payable on such tax remains unpaid, the same shall be recovered under the provisions of section 79.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been added to clarify the provision of sub-section (12) of section 75?
question_answer_pairs.answer: An explanation has been added to sub-section (12) of section 75 to clarify that \"self-assessed tax\" shall include the tax payable in respect of outward supplies, the details of which have been furnished under section 37, but not included in the return furnished under section 39.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the effective date of the clarification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The clarification has effect from 01.01.2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the doubts being raised by the trade and the field formations regarding modalities for initiation of the recovery proceedings under section 79 of the Act in the cases covered under the explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Doubts are being raised by the trade and the field formations regarding modalities for initiation of the recovery proceedings under section 79 of the Act in the cases covered under the explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the CGST Act, 2017 referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The CGST Act, 2017 is the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Finance Act, 2021 referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Finance Act, 2021 is the Act passed by the Parliament of India in 2021 to give effect to the financial proposals of the Central Government for the fiscal year 2021-22.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the \"Act\" referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The \"Act\" referred to in the document is the CGST Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the explanation added to sub-section (12) of section 75?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the explanation added to sub-section (12) of section 75 is to clarify that \"self-assessed tax\" shall include the tax payable in respect of outward supplies, the details of which have been furnished under section 37, but not included in the return furnished under section 39.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the section 39 referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 39 of the CGST Act, 2017 deals with the furnishing of returns.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the section 37 referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 37 of the CGST Act, 2017 deals with the furnishing of details of outward supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the section 79 referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 79 of the CGST Act, 2017 deals with the recovery of tax.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to provide guidelines for recovery proceedings under the provisions of section 79 of the CGST Act, 2017 in cases covered under the explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document has been issued by the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, GST Policy Wing, Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: CBEC-20/16/05/2021-GST is the file number or reference number of the document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the GST Policy Wing referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GST Policy Wing is a division or department within the Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, Government of India that deals with Goods and Services Tax (GST) policy matters.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) is the apex indirect tax authority in India under the Department of Revenue, Ministry of Finance, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Department of Revenue referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Department of Revenue is a department under the Ministry of Finance, Government of India that is responsible for the administration of taxes and other government revenues.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Ministry of Finance referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Finance is a ministry of the Government of India responsible for the economy of India, financial legislation, financial institutions, capital markets, center-state financial relations, and the Union Budget.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Government of India referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government of India is the central government of the Republic of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the explanation added to sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the explanation added to sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017 is to clarify that \"self-assessed tax\" shall include the tax payable in respect of outward supplies, the details of which have been furnished under section 37, but not included in the return furnished under section 39.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the section 73 referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 73 of the CGST Act, 2017 deals with the determination of tax not paid or short paid or erroneously refunded or input tax credit wrongly availed or utilized for any reason other than fraud or any wilful misstatement or suppression of facts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the section 74 referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 74 of the CGST Act, 2017 deals with the determination of tax not paid or short paid or erroneously refunded or input tax credit wrongly availed or utilized by reason of fraud or any wilful misstatement or suppression of facts.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to provide guidelines for recovery proceedings under the provisions of section 79 of the CGST Act, 2017 in cases covered under the explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number of the instruction?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is Instruction No. 01/2022-GST.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated 7th January, 2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the document is Guidelines for recovery proceedings under the provisions of section 79 of the CGST Act, 2017 in cases covered under explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017-Reg.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the document addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to The Principal Chief Commissioners / Chief Commissioners / Principal Commissioners / Commissioners of Central Tax (All) and The Principal Directors General / Directors General (All).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to provide guidelines for recovery proceedings under the provisions of section 79 of the CGST Act, 2017 in cases covered under explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017 about?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Sub-section (12) of section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017 provides that notwithstanding anything contained in section 73 or section 74 of the Act, where any amount of self-assessed tax in accordance with the return furnished under section 39 remains unpaid, either wholly or partly, or any amount of interest payable on such tax remains unpaid, the same shall be recovered under the provisions of section 79.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been clarified regarding \"self-assessed tax\" under section (12) of section 75?
question_answer_pairs.answer: An explanation has been added to sub-section (12) of section 75 vide section 114 of the Finance Act, 2021 with effect from 01.01.2022 to clarify that \"self-assessed tax\" shall include the tax payable in respect of outward supplies, the details of which have been furnished under section 37, but not included in the return furnished under section 39.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the doubts being raised by the trade and the field formations regarding modalities for initiation of the recovery proceedings under section 79 of the Act in the cases covered under the explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Doubts are being raised by the trade and the field formations regarding modalities for initiation of the recovery proceedings under section 79 of the Act in the cases covered under the explanation to sub-section (12) of section 75.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Act referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Act referred to in the document is the CGST Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the section 79 of the CGST Act, 2017 about?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 79 of the CGST Act, 2017 deals with recovery of tax.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017 about?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 75 of the CGST Act, 2017 deals with determination of tax not paid or short paid or erroneously refunded or input tax credit wrongly availed or utilized for any reason other than fraud or any wilful-misstatement or suppression of facts.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this government order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is F. No. 16-5/2017-TEL and the date is January, 15th 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government department issued this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is issued by the Department of Higher Education, Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide WIFI services in the campus of higher educational institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What event led to this order being issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The National Convention on Digital Initiatives for Higher Education held in New Delhi on 9th July 2017 resolved to take all steps required for converting higher educational institutions into digital campuses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What platform does the order mention for accessing educational content?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order mentions the SWAYAM platform for accessing educational content.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the order presuppose the existence of in higher educational institutions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order presupposes the existence of high speed internet access and WIFI facility.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How would the creation of digital campuses require a larger national effort?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The creation of digital campuses would require a larger national effort involving both private and public players, including Telecom service providers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What opportunities does the order mention opening up for Telecom Service Providers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order mentions the opportunities that opened up for Telecom Service Providers (TSPs) to participate in this effort.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the heads of higher educational institutions advised to do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The heads of the higher educational institutions may be advised to contact the Telecom Service Providers (TSPs) / Internet Service Providers (ISPs) licensed by Department of Telecom for providing Broadband services.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is expected regarding the facility to be provided by the TSPs/ISPs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is expected that the facility is to be provided by the TSPs/ISPs at their own cost, and there shall be no financial implications to the institution on account of implementation of this project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the University/College/Institution be informed about the Telecom Service Providers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A letter may be sent by the University/College/Institution to the licensed telecom/internet service providers, and also post it on their respective websites.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When should the list of Telecom Service Providers be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The list of Telecom Service Providers is to be sent by 15th Feb 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can the list of Telecom Service Providers licensed by the Department of Telecom be accessed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The list of Internet Service Providers licensed by the Dept of Telecom is available at the provided website link.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the National Convention on Digital Initiatives for Higher Education held in July 2017?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The National Convention resolved to take all steps required for converting higher educational institutions into digital campuses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How would the digital campus help all students/faculty to access the same from their laptop and mobile?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The digital campus with high speed internet access and WIFI facility would help all the students/faculty to access the same from their laptop and mobile.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of Telecom Service Providers in the creation of digital campuses?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Telecom Service Providers are expected to participate in this effort to effectively channelize the opportunities that opened up.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Why are the heads of higher educational institutions advised to contact the Telecom Service Providers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To avail the Broadband services for provision of WIFI services in their respective campuses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the expected outcome regarding the financial implications of providing WIFI services?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There shall be no financial implications to the institution on account of implementation of this project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the University/College/Institution inform the Telecom Service Providers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: By sending a letter to the licensed telecom/internet service providers and also posting it on their respective websites.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the list of Telecom Service Providers to be provided?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The list will enable the higher educational institutions to contact the appropriate Telecom Service Providers for availing Broadband services.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the order in terms of providing WIFI services in higher educational institutions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To enable access to digital educational content through the SWAYAM platform.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the order envision the creation of digital campuses?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Through a larger national effort involving both private and public players, including Telecom service providers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of Telecom Service Providers as per the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To participate in the effort to effectively channelize the opportunities that opened up.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the expected timeline for the list of Telecom Service Providers to be provided?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The list is to be sent by 15th Feb 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can the licensed Telecom Service Providers list be accessed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The list is available at the provided website link.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the National Convention held in July 2017?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It resolved to take steps for converting higher educational institutions into digital campuses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the digital campus help students and faculty access educational content?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The high speed internet access and WIFI facility will enable access from laptops and mobiles.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the expected financial implication for higher educational institutions in implementing this project?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There shall be no financial implications as per the order.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the higher educational institutions inform the Telecom Service Providers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: By sending a letter and also posting on their respective websites.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to monitor the status of implementation of E-lekha reporting system to generate expenditure report of PWD on daily basis.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been observed regarding the implementation of E-lekha reporting system?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been observed that some of the EEs/DDOs of PWD are not complying with the instructions due to which PAO-22 is unable to generate consolidated expenditure file of PWD on daily basis.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What deficiencies have been reported on the part of some of the Executive Engineers/DDOs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Following deficiencies have been reported on the part of some of the Executive Engineers/DDOs relating to the implementation of E-lekha reporting system.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What corrective actions are required to be taken by the EEs/DDOs of PWD?
question_answer_pairs.answer: EEs/DDOs of PWD are required to send the text file on daily basis to PAO-22 by 5 PM on the same day or by 10.30AM on next day.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be done if there is no transaction on any particular day?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In case there is no transactions on any PAO-22, without fail.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be done with the text files?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Text files should be generated with due care, checked/errors in the text files should be rectified immediately and the fresh text file should be sent immediately on the same day, through mail.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the DDOs do with the mail?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Mail of the DDOs should be checked frequently to know the urgent communications from PAO-22 or any other authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be done with the telephonic calls received from the PAO-22?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All telephonic calls received from the PAO-22 to sort out the above issues should be attended.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be done to incorporate the back date data in the system?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Proper module NPA02020 provided by I.T agency should be used for generating daily text files.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How should the cash book should be maintained?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Cash book should be maintained on day to day basis and closed on same day as stipulated under CPWD code/GFR and other Govt rules.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be done with the recording entries on back date for any reasons not admissible as per rules?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Recording entries on back date for any reasons not admissible as per rules.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who should be contacted in case of technical problems?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In case of technical problems, Divisions may contact the software agency Shri Dileep, Mob No.9350313140/8178136480.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number mentioned in the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is No. E-In-C/PWD/W/E-lekha/2020/4254.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is dated 14/11/2020.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the order addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is addressed to 1) All the Executive Engineers/DDOs-PWD divisions, and 2) All the AAOs/Divisional Accountants-PWD divisions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Monitoring report on the status of implementation of E-lekha reporting system to generate expenditure report of PWD on daily basis, Shortcomings on the part of Executive Engineers/DDOs to achieve the target.\"\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis of this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The basis of this order is the status report received from PAO-22 regarding implementation of E-lekha reporting system.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been observed regarding the implementation of E-lekha reporting system?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been observed that some of the EEs/DDOs of PWD are not complying with the instructions due to which PAO-22 is unable to generate consolidated expenditure file of PWD on daily basis.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the shortcomings/deficiencies reported on the part of some of the Executive Engineers/DDOs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Following deficiencies have been reported on the part of some of the Executive Engineers/DDOs relating to the implementation of E-lekha reporting system.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What corrective actions are required to be taken by the EEs/DDOs of PWD?
question_answer_pairs.answer: EEs/DDOs of PWD are required to send the text file on daily basis to PAO-22 by 5 PM on the same day or by 10.30AM on next day.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Filling up one post of Member(Non-Official), Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP) in level-14 (Rs.144200-218200) of Pay Matrix, on contract basis for a period of three years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the letter addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Chief Secretaries of all State Governments/UTs (North Zone).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is dated 7th June, 2023.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name and designation of the person who signed the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is signed by the Under Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the qualifications required for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter mentions that the persons to be considered should have the following qualifications: (i) Persons whose main profession is farming; (ii) Persons having outstanding achievements in crop production, farming practices or any other agricultural fields; (iii) The leaders of kisan movements; and (iv) Persons who have made significant contribution to agricultural production or marketing and other allied activities or made outstanding achievements in agriculture production.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How long is the contract period for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The contract is for a period of three years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay level for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay level is 14 (Rs.144200-218200) of Pay Matrix.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is responsible for the appointment of the person to the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The appointment is to be made by the Appointment Committee of the Cabinet (ACC).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the ministry that issued the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is issued by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Department of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the address mentioned in the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The address mentioned is 452-A, Krishi Bhawan, New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who should be contacted for further details regarding the application process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter mentions that the name of the persons to be considered for the post may be furnished in the enclosed format (preferably in MS Word) along with a recent passport size photograph and a brief bio-data/curriculum vitae, which may please be sent to Shri Anil Kumar, Under Secretary, E&S(Est.) Section, Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Room No. 452-A, Krishi Bhawan, New Delhi-110001, within thirty days from the date of issue of this letter.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the key qualifications mentioned for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter mentions that the persons to be considered should have the following qualifications: (i) Persons whose main profession is farming; (ii) Persons having outstanding achievements in crop production, farming practices or any other agricultural fields; (iii) The leaders of kisan movements; and (iv) Persons who have made significant contribution to agricultural production or marketing and other allied activities or made outstanding achievements in agriculture production.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is responsible for the final selection of the candidate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The appointment is to be made by the Appointment Committee of the Cabinet (ACC).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is for filling up one post of Member(Non-Official), Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP) in level-14 (Rs.144200-218200) of Pay Matrix, on contract basis for a period of three years.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is signed by the Under Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designation of the person who signed the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is signed by the Under Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number of the letter is F.No.A.12026/02/2020-EA.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter mentions that the name of the persons to be considered for the post may be furnished in the enclosed format (preferably in MS Word) along with a recent passport size photograph and a brief bio-data/curriculum vitae, which may please be sent to Shri Anil Kumar, Under Secretary, E&S(Est.) Section, Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Room No. 452-A, Krishi Bhawan, New Delhi-110001.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter states that the applications should be submitted within thirty days from the date of issue of the letter.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay level is 14 (Rs.144200-218200) of Pay Matrix.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 61st NDC Course at National Defence College, New Delhi commencing from 1st Feb, 2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has been selected to attend the 61st Course at National Defence College?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Dr. Jayaraj Naik, IDAS, presently serving as CDA (Funds), Meerut has been selected.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When is the officer joining the NDC course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officer is joining the course on 28th January 2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What duties will the officer perform during the period of the course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: During the period of course, Dr. Jayaraj Naik, IDAS, will be borne on the proforma strength of the office of the CGDA, Delhi Cantt. and all expenditure, including tuition fee, pay & allowances and other expenditure in connection with the Course in respect of the officer, is to be borne/paid by AN-I(Pay) section (locally) Training Division (CENTRAD) office of the CGDA, Delhi Cantt.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the officer required to execute before joining the NDC course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officer will be required to execute a 'Bond' and submit the same to the Cadre Controlling Authority stating that he would serve the Government for a period of five years and he would be willing to work in Ministry of Home Affairs, Ministry of Defence, Ministry of External Affairs, NSCG and other security related organizations on completion of the course, or to repay the total expenses incurred on the NDC Course in the event of his resignation, voluntary retirement or quitting the NDC Course without completing it.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What may be initiated in SPARROW system for the officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The APAR of the officer till the date of relief from the present charge/post may be initiated in SPARROW system.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What information may also be informed that the officer should submit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officer may also be informed that he should submit his self appraisal within 15 days of generation of MHPAR.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where should the copy of the Part II Office Order issued in this regard be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The copy of the Part II Office Order issued in this regard may please be sent in due course.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The file number is AN-I/133/3/NDC/61.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Controller General of Defence Accounts is Kapil Raj, IDAS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the address of the Controller General of Defence Accounts office?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The address is Ulan Batar Road, Palam, Delhi Cantt.-110010.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the telephone number of the Controller General of Defence Accounts office?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The telephone number is 011-25674810.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The fax number is 011-25674781.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of the letter is 20.01.2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the letter addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is addressed to The CDA (Funds), Meerut.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the letter is to inform about the selection of Dr. Jayaraj Naik, IDAS, presently serving as CDA (Funds), Meerut to attend the 61st NDC Course at National Defence College, New Delhi commencing from 1st Feb, 2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the NDC course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NDC course is commencing from 1st Feb, 2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the joining time for the officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The joining time is admissible to the officer as per extant rules.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the signatory of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is signed by Sr. Jt. CGDA (Admin).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Bond that the officer is required to execute?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the Bond is that the officer would serve the Government for a period of five years and he would be willing to work in Ministry of Home Affairs, Ministry of Defence, Ministry of External Affairs, NSCG and other security related organizations on completion of the course, or to repay the total expenses incurred on the NDC Course in the event of his resignation, voluntary retirement or quitting the NDC Course without completing it.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is issued by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated 23.10.2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the document is \"Sharing of faculty members - Initiating disciplinary actions - reg.\"\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to inform that the AICTE has noticed some institutes offering programs/courses in Technical Education are indulging in the practice of sharing of faculty members among institutions under the same parent organization/outside, which hampers the quality of technical education.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What action will the Council take on such complaints/information received?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Council shall initiate inquiry on any such complaint/information received and if found correct, shall initiate strong disciplinary action against the institute indulging in such practice, including withdrawal of Approval.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Member Secretary of the AICTE?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Member Secretary of the AICTE is Prof. Rajive Kumar.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the address of the AICTE office mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The address of the AICTE office is Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi-110070.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the contact information of the AICTE office mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The contact information includes the phone number 011-29581407 and the email address: ms@aicte-india.org.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of this document as per the \"Copy to:\" section?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The recipients are 1) The Principal Secretary, HEDN, 2) Vice Chancellor, All Universities, 3) Directorate of Technical Education, All States, and 4) PS to Governor.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of sharing faculty members among institutions as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that the sharing of faculty members among institutions under the same parent organization/outside is not permitted as it hampers the quality of technical education.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence of institutes found indulging in the practice of sharing faculty members?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Council shall initiate strong disciplinary action against such institutes, including withdrawal of Approval.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which specific regulation or guideline is being referred to in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document does not explicitly mention any specific regulation or guideline, but refers to the \"practice of sharing of faculty members\" as the issue being addressed.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: EoA stands for Extension of Approval.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: AICTE stands for All India Council for Technical Education.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The AICTE is the authority that grants Approval or Extension of Approval to technical education institutes.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Approval or Extension of Approval granted by the AICTE is to ensure the quality of technical education programs/courses offered by the institutes.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The AICTE emblem signifies the official nature and authority of the document issued by the AICTE.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Approval Bureau is the department within the AICTE that deals with granting Approval or Extension of Approval to technical education institutes.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Principal/Director refers to the head of the AICTE-approved institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason cited is the practice of sharing of faculty members among institutions under the same parent organization/outside, which hampers the quality of technical education.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the sharing of faculty members hamper the quality of technical education as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that the sharing of faculty members simultaneously in two places/locations is not permitted, and this practice hampers the quality of technical education.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document suggests that the AICTE relies on complaints/information received to initiate inquiries and take disciplinary action against non-compliant institutes.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Staff Service Rules of multi-state cooperative societies/banks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been brought to the knowledge of the Department of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Many multi-state cooperative societies/banks have not framed Staff Service Rules.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are all multi-state cooperative societies/banks directed to frame staff service rules for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All multi-state cooperative societies/banks are hereby directed to frame staff service rules.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the Staff Service Rules include among other things?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Staff Service Rules shall include the following: a) No person to be recruited directly by the multi-state cooperative societies/banks on pick-and-choose manner, b) Staff shall be recruited through employment exchanges or by framing proper guidelines which includes conduct of written test, interview, etc., c) No staff to be recruited without having recognized qualifications in the field of cooperation/cooperative training, and d) The service rules shall also include the method of recruitment, job qualification requirement, pay scales, seniority, probation, leave, retirement, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the multi-state cooperative societies/banks directed to do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All the multi-state cooperative societies/banks are hereby directed to frame the Staff Service Rules as per the above guidelines and send a copy of the same to this Department within a period of three months from the date of this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This circular is issued with the approval of the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Additional Commissioner (Cooperation) mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Additional Commissioner (Cooperation) mentioned is P. Sampath.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the contact number of the Additional Commissioner (Cooperation)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The contact number of the Additional Commissioner (Cooperation) is 011-23386268.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Shri Suraj, Senior Programmer, NIC, mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Shri Suraj, Senior Programmer, NIC, is mentioned for uploading the departmental website www.mca.nic.gov.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the circular is to direct all multi-state cooperative societies/banks to frame staff service rules.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this circular issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This circular was issued on 31st July, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where was this circular issued from?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This circular was issued from Krishi Bhawan, New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number of this circular is No. R-11017/19/2017-L&M.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the department that has issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers' Welfare (Office of Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies) has issued this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main reason for issuing this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Many multi-state cooperative societies/banks have not framed Staff Service Rules, which has led to complaints/grievances against the management of the multi-state cooperative societies/banks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first directive given to all multi-state cooperative societies/banks?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All multi-state cooperative societies/banks are hereby directed to frame staff service rules immediately.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second directive given to all multi-state cooperative societies/banks?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The guidelines of RBI may also be taken into account while framing the service rules.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first requirement mentioned for the Staff Service Rules?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No person to be recruited directly by the multi-state cooperative societies/banks on pick-and-choose manner.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second requirement mentioned for the Staff Service Rules?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Staff shall be recruited through employment exchanges or by framing proper guidelines which includes conduct of written test, interview, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the third requirement mentioned for the Staff Service Rules?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No staff to be recruited without having recognized qualifications in the field of cooperation/cooperative training.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fourth requirement mentioned for the Staff Service Rules?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The service rules shall also include the method of recruitment, job qualification requirement, pay scales, seniority, probation, leave, retirement, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time period given to the multi-state cooperative societies/banks to send a copy of the Staff Service Rules to the Department?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A period of three months from the date of this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has approved the issuance of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This circular is issued with the approval of the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designation of the officer who has signed this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officer who has signed this circular is the Additional Commissioner (Cooperation).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the officer who has signed this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The name of the officer who has signed this circular is P. Sampath.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is this circular distributed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This circular is distributed to all multi-state cooperative societies/banks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is responsible for uploading this circular on the departmental website?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Shri Suraj, Senior Programmer, NIC, is responsible for uploading this circular on the departmental website www.mca.nic.gov.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main objective of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main objective of this circular is to ensure that all multi-state cooperative societies/banks frame proper staff service rules to address complaints/grievances against the management.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key issue that has led to the issuance of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Many multi-state cooperative societies/banks have not framed Staff Service Rules, leading to complaints/grievances against the management.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Staff Service Rules of multi-state cooperative societies/banks.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The order states that the Contractor vide letter dated 30.05.2022 submitted their representation with the request not to initiate any punitive action against them. The Contractor vide letter dated 30.05.2022 also mentioned that as a self-imposed disciplinary measure, they shall not be participating in any bids of NHAI for a period of one month i.e. from 30.05.2022 to 29.06.2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the proposal mentioned in the order regarding the Contractor's participation in NHAI/MoRTH projects?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order states that in view of the grave nature of the incident, the proposal to disallow Contractor to bid for NHAI/MoRTH projects has been considered. However, the Authority has taken cognizance of Contractor's representation dated 30.05.2022, and in the interim, hereby agrees with Contractor's self-imposed disciplinary measure to refrain from participating in bids of NHAI/MoRTH.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The order mentions the signed Contract Agreement dated 08.10.2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which company was awarded the subject works as per the Agreement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As per the Agreement, M/s Coastal India Limited - Patil Engineering Limited (JV) (hereinafter also referred to as the \"Contractor\") was awarded the subject works.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the location of the project mentioned in the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The project is located in the UT of Jammu & Kashmir.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the section of NH-1A (Now NH-44) mentioned in the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order mentions the Ramban to Banihal Section of NH-1A (Now NH-44).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the chainage range of the North Bound section of the project?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The North Bound section is from Ch.158+675 to Ch.164+660.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Regulation of initial pay on promotion or appointment to a higher post-benefit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide instructions regarding the regulation of initial pay on promotion or appointment to a higher post-benefit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the intended recipient of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All Ministries of the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 3rd April, 1972.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the government department that issued this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Ministry of Finance (Department of Expenditure).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the regulation mentioned in this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide at least one increment in pay on promotion or appointment to a higher post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the undersigned authority of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Deputy Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the pay of a government servant who is promoted to a higher post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay of the government servant shall be fixed in accordance with FR 22-C.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the amendment mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the pay of a government servant who is promoted to a higher post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The amendment is to provide for one increment in pay on promotion or appointment to a higher post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference to the previous order mentioned in this office memorandum?
What is the condition mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the pay of a government servant who is promoted to a higher post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The condition is that the pay in the higher post should be fixed at a stage which would be one increment above the pay in the ex-cadre post immediately held.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the availability of the benefit of one increment in pay on promotion or appointment to a higher post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The clarification is that the benefit of one increment in pay is still continues to be available.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason mentioned in this office memorandum for the benefit of one increment in pay on promotion or appointment to a higher post becoming obsolete?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason is that the orders dated 15.9.71 have become obsolete and it is no longer permissible to grant a higher post on the basis of pay in the ex-cadre post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the decision mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the pay of government servants on promotion or appointment to a higher post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The President is pleased to decide that the pay of government servants on promotion or appointment to a higher post should be regulated in accordance with the provisions of OM dated 15.9.71.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the difference in pay between the promoted post and the previous post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The difference in pay between the promoted post and the previous post should be treated as personal pay to be absorbed in future increments or increases in pay.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor General of India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor General of India is required for the Departments concerned.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the effective date mentioned in this office memorandum for the regulation of initial pay on promotion or appointment to a higher post-benefit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The effective date is not explicitly mentioned in the office memorandum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference to the previous order mentioned in this office memorandum?
What is the provision mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the pay of a government servant who is promoted to a higher post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay of the government servant shall be fixed in accordance with FR 22-C.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the amendment mentioned in this office memorandum regarding the pay of a government servant who is promoted to a higher post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The amendment is to provide for one increment in pay on promotion or appointment to a higher post.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is No.Z-28016/87/2017-PMSSY-III and the date is 04 November, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is issued by the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is to constitute a Technical Committee to examine Detailed Project Reports (DPRs) regarding medical equipment, submitted by the Executing Agency, through the respective Government Medical Colleges in respect of Phase-IV/V(A) of Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the members of the Technical Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The members are Shri Rajeev Kanavujia, Sr. Architect, CDB; Shri Mukesh Bajpai, Sr. Architect, CDB; Shri R. M. Singh, Sr. Consultant, PMSSY; and Shri Rafat H. Hussain, Consultant (Elect.).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the Technical Committee do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Technical Committee will examine and review the DPRs submitted by the PMSSY Division for consideration by the Project Management Committee. They will also take into consideration the functional requirements, effective use of space for facilitating smooth flow of patients, doctors and services, adoption of best practices, IPHS guidelines, cost parameters etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Within what time period will the Technical Committee furnish its findings/comments?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The committee would furnish its findings/comments within a period of 7 days.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the signatory of this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is signed by Vinod Kumar, Under Secretary to Govt. of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is this order addressed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is addressed to the Chairman and all members of the Committee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two entities mentioned for information copy?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The information copy is to be provided to PPS to JS (SS) and PMSSY website.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The order was issued by the PMSSY Division.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is dated 04 November, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is for the partial modification of the Ministry's Order of even number dated 26.07.2017, with the approval of competent authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the members of the Technical Committee mentioned in the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The members of the Technical Committee are: i. Shri Rajeev Kanuajia, Sr. Architect, CDB; ii. Shri Mukesh Bajpai, Sr. Architect, CDB; iii. Shri R. M. Singh, Sr. Consultant, PMSSY; iv. Shri Rafat H. Hussain, Consultant (Elect.).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Technical Committee?

What is the document number and date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is No. Z-28016/24/2014-SSH and the date is May, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MHFW) issued this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Reconstitution of Selection Committees for filling up Faculty/Non-Faculty/Resident/Contractual Posts in New AIIMS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Ministry been receiving references about?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry has been receiving references from the new AIIMS for filling up various positions in Faculty/Non Faculty, Engagement of Residents as well as Contractual appointments to Faculty posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Ministry decided regarding the new AIIMS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry has decided that the new AIIMS would require to be armed with certain delegated powers, streamlining of procedures, so as to bring about an effective turnaround in building up human resources.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the circular state regarding the functional requirements of the new AIIMS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the Ministry, after careful consideration regarding the functional requirements of the new AIIMS, has reflected the relevant provisions under the AIIMS Act 1956.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What rules have been referred to in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular refers to the AIIMS (Amendment) Act 2012, the AIIMS Rules 1999 and AIIMS Regulation 1999 as applicable.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the aim of the circular in terms of the various Institutions/Guidelines/Orders?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aim is to bring about consolidation of the various Institutions/Guidelines/Orders regarding the recruitment in various posts, as detailed below.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Selection Committee mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Selection Committee is for regular appointment to Faculty posts in the new AIIMS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will constitute the Standing Selection Committee (SSC) for the new AIIMS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Standing Selection Committee (SSC) will be of the respective new AIIMS as notified vide MHFW Order No. Z-28016/42/2013 dated 17th February 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis for the constitution of the Standing Selection Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Standing Selection Committee is being constituted in pursuance of the decision taken in the first meeting of the Institute Body(ies) of the six New All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) thereby authorizing the President (Hon'ble Health & Family Welfare Minister) to constitute the same.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the relevant provisions of the AIIMS Act 1956 that the circular refers to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular refers to the relevant provisions of the AIIMS Act 1956, as amended by the AIIMS Amendment Act, 2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When were the previous circulars on this subject issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous circulars on this subject were issued on 4th April 2013, 6th August 2013 and 18th July 2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the timeline for the reconstitution of the Selection Committees mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the reconstitution of the Selection Committees is to be done now, in light of the references received from the new AIIMS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many new AIIMS are mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular mentions the six new AIIMS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis for the constitution of the Standing Selection Committee for the new AIIMS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Standing Selection Committee is being constituted in pursuance of the decision taken in the first meeting of the Institute Body(ies) of the six New AIIMS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be the Chairperson of the Standing Selection Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The President (Hon'ble Health & Family Welfare Minister) will be the Chairperson of the Standing Selection Committee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Standing Selection Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Standing Selection Committee is to consider and select candidates for various Faculty posts in the new AIIMS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the frequency of meetings of the Standing Selection Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not specify the frequency of meetings of the Standing Selection Committee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the members of the Standing Selection Committee be appointed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not provide details on how the members of the Standing Selection Committee will be appointed.
