question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this vacancy circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is F.No.P.15025/60/2021-FR and the date is 7th July, 2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry has issued this vacancy circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Department of Health & Family Welfare (Food Regulation Section) has issued this vacancy circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the position being advertised for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The position being advertised is for the Chairperson of the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the previous advertisement for this position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous advertisement was published in employment news dated 17.07.2021 and 17.02/11/0005/2223 dated 30.04.2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the scale of pay for this position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The scale of pay is Rs. 2,25,000/- per month (Fixed) plus allowances as per guidelines issued by the Department of Personnel and Training (DoPT).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for this position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Applicants for selection to the office of Chairperson, FSSAI shall be persons of eminence in the field of Food Science or persons from Administration who have been associated with the subject and are either holding or have held a position not below the rank of Secretary to the Govt. of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the relevant work experience required for this position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Relevant work experience related to Central/ State Regulatory Bodies would be a desirable qualification for the position.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit and tenure for this position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chairperson shall hold office for a term of three years from the date on which he/she enters upon the office and shall be eligible for re-appointment for a further period of three years or till he/she attains the age of 65 years, whichever is earlier.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the Head Office of the FSSAI located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Head Office of the FSSAI is in Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the duties and functions of the Chairperson of FSSAI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chairperson of the FSSAI is to perform such duties and functions and exercise such powers as prescribed under the Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006 and the rules and regulations made there under.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for applying for this position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not mention the application process.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the FSSAI established as a statutory body?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The FSSAI was established as a Statutory body under the Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the FSSAI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The FSSAI is responsible for laying down science-based standards for articles of food and to regulate their manufacture, storage, distribution, sale and import, to ensure availability of safe and wholesome food for human consumption.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the composition of the FSSAI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not provide information on the composition of the FSSAI.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many members are there on the FSSAI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not specify the number of members on the FSSAI.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the qualifications required for the Chairperson position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the Chairperson shall be a person of eminence in the field of Food Science or a person from Administration who has been associated with the subject.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can the Chairperson be re-appointed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, the Chairperson shall be eligible for re-appointment for a further period of three years or till he/she attains the age of 65 years, whichever is earlier.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the salary structure for the Chairperson position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The salary is Rs. 2,25,000/- per month (Fixed) plus allowances as per guidelines issued by the Department of Personnel and Training (DoPT).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the selection process for the Chairperson position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not provide details on the selection process.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not specify who is responsible for appointing the Chairperson.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not list the key responsibilities of the Chairperson.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not provide this information.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not discuss any challenges.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not provide information on coordination with other bodies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the future plans and priorities of the FSSAI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not outline any future plans or priorities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the FSSAI ensure food safety and standards across the country?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the FSSAI is responsible for laying down science-based standards and regulating manufacture, storage, distribution, sale and import of food to ensure availability of safe and wholesome food.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is dated 10.07.2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of this office memorandum is \"Clarification on permission to travel by private airlines on the sectors where Air India does not operate its flight.\"\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the undersigned in this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The undersigned in this office memorandum is Chandra Kishor Shukla, Under Secretary to Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the telephone number of the undersigned?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The telephone number of the undersigned is 24619282.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is this office memorandum addressed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This office memorandum is addressed to All Secretaries, Govt. of India and All Financial Advisors, Govt. of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this office memorandum is to provide clarification on permission to travel by private airlines on the sectors where Air India does not operate its flights.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference document mentioned in this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference document mentioned is O.M. No. AV-18050/1/2017-AI dated 05.06.2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key issue discussed in this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The key issue discussed is the provisions contained in the Ministry's O.M. No. AV-18050/1/2017-AI dated 05.06.2017 regarding the relaxation for travel by private airlines.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification provided in this office memorandum regarding the provisions of the above-mentioned O
question_answer_pairs.answer: The clarification provided is that the provisions of the above-mentioned O.M. are also applicable in the case of Leave Travel Concession.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the additional clarification provided regarding the provisions of the above-mentioned O
question_answer_pairs.answer: The additional clarification is that the provisions of the above-mentioned O.M. are also applicable in cases where there is no Air India flight between two cities, but they are connected through any connecting flight of Air India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the statement made regarding the examination of the issues mentioned in this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The statement made is that the above issues have been examined in this Ministry and it is stated that provisions contained in O.M. No. AV-18050/1/2017-AI dated 05.06.2017 are not applicable in cases of LTC.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the further clarification provided regarding the relaxation for travel by private airlines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The further clarification is that the relaxation for travel by private airlines is given in those sectors only where Air India is not operating.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the additional condition mentioned regarding the sectors where the relaxation for travel by private airlines is applicable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The additional condition is that the sectors should be connected with any Air India connecting flights.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference to the Ministry of Finance's O
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference is to the Ministry of Finance's O.M. No. 19024/1/2009-E.IV dated 07.06.2016.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of referring to the Ministry of Finance's O
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of referring to the Ministry of Finance's O.M. is to state that Government officers should prefer to travel by Air India in accordance with the provision contained in that O.M.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"NOTIFICATION\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government body issued this notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government of India, Ministry of Human Resource Development, Department of Higher Education, ICR Division issued this notification.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this notification dated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This notification is dated the 2nd July, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this notification is to declare, on the advice of the UGC, an institution of higher learning as deemed to be University.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which Act empowers the Central Government to declare an institution as a deemed University?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 empowers the Central Government to declare an institution as a deemed University.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which institutions are mentioned in this notification as being declared as deemed universities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Morarjee Dental College & Hospital, Chennai and the MGR Engineering College, Maduravoyal, Chennai are mentioned as being declared as deemed universities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition for these institutions to adhere to as deemed universities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These institutions must adhere to the guidelines/instructions issued by the UGC and AICTE from time to time.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What other institution is mentioned in this notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ACS Medical College & Hospital, Chennai is also mentioned in this notification.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the status of the ACS Medical College & Hospital, Chennai as per this notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ACS Medical College & Hospital, Chennai is mentioned as a Constituent Institution subject to the outcome of the Viplav Sharma's case in W.P. (C) No. 142 of 2006 pending in the Supreme Court.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the functioning of the MGR Educational & Research Institute, Chennai reviewed by the UGC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The functioning of the MGR Educational & Research Institute, Chennai was reviewed by the UGC with the help of an Expert Committee during 2-4th November, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the outcome of the UGC Expert Committee's review?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The report of the Expert Committee was placed before the Commission in its 528th meeting held on 09.01.2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the Commission's decision based on the Expert Committee's report?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Commission considered the report and passed the following resolutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What were the resolutions passed by the Commission based on the Expert Committee's report?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Commission considered and approved the report with the condition that the suggestions by the visiting Expert Committee, if any, will be addressed within a period of six months and the compliance report would be submitted along with documentary proof to UGC.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What observation was made regarding the land of the deemed to be university?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It was observed that some of the land is leased to the deemed to be university Trust.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which section of the UGC Act, 1956 empowers the Central Government to declare an institution as a deemed university?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 3 of the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 empowers the Central Government to declare an institution as a deemed university.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the Central Government exercise the powers conferred by Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 to declare the institutions mentioned in this notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government exercised the powers conferred by Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 to declare the institutions mentioned in this notification vide its Notification No.9-1/2002-U.3(A) dated 21.01.2003.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the Central Government's Notification No.9-1/2002-U.3(A) dated 21.01.2003?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the Central Government's Notification No.9-1/2002-U.3(A) dated 21.01.2003 was to declare the Morarjee Dental College & Hospital, Chennai and the MGR Engineering College, Maduravoyal, Chennai as institutions deemed to be University.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition mentioned in this notification regarding the adherence to guidelines/instructions issued by UGC and AICTE?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The institutions must adhere to the guidelines/instructions issued by the UGC and AICTE from time to time.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the Central Government exercise the powers conferred by Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 to permit the inclusion of ACS Medical College & Hospital, Chennai as a Constituent Institution?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government vide its Notification No.10-9/2007-U.3(A) dated 25th September, 2014 permitted the inclusion of ACS Medical College & Hospital, Chennai as a Constituent Institution.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the status of the Viplav Sharma's case in W.P. (C) No. 142 of 2006 pending in the Supreme Court?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The inclusion of the ACS Medical College & Hospital, Chennai as a Constituent Institution is subject to the outcome of the Viplav Sharma's case in W.P. (C) No. 142 of 2006 pending in the Supreme Court.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the functioning of the MGR Educational & Research Institute, Chennai reviewed by the UGC with the help of an Expert Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The functioning of the MGR Educational & Research Institute, Chennai was reviewed by the UGC with the help of an Expert Committee during 2-4th November, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the UGC Expert Committee's review of the MGR Educational & Research Institute, Chennai?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the UGC Expert Committee's review was to assess the functioning of the MGR Educational & Research Institute, Chennai.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the report of the UGC Expert Committee placed before the Commission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The report of the UGC Expert Committee was placed before the Commission in its 528th meeting held on 09.01.2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the Commission's decision based on the UGC Expert Committee's report?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Commission considered the report and passed the following resolutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What were the conditions attached to the Commission's approval of the UGC Expert Committee's report?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Commission approved the report with the condition that the suggestions by the visiting Expert Committee, if any, will be addressed within a period of six months and the compliance report would be submitted along with documentary proof to UGC.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What observation was made regarding the land of the deemed to be university in this notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It was observed that some of the land is leased to the deemed to be university Trust.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which section of the UGC Act, 1956 empowers the Central Government to declare an institution as a deemed university?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 3 of the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 empowers the Central Government to declare an institution as a deemed university.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the Central Government exercise the powers conferred by Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 to declare the institutions mentioned in this notification as deemed universities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government exercised the powers conferred by Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 to declare the institutions mentioned in this notification vide its Notification No.9-1/2002-U.3(A) dated 21.01.2003.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition mentioned in this notification regarding the adherence to guidelines/instructions issued by UGC and AICTE by the deemed universities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The institutions must adhere to the guidelines/instructions issued by the UGC and AICTE from time to time.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The ICR Division is located at Shastri Bhawan, New Delhi-01.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: This notification is dated the 2nd July, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government is empowered under Section 3 of the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 to declare an institution as a University.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No.9-1/2002-U.3(A.1) dated 21.01.2003 is mentioned in this document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which institutions were declared as Deemed to be University in this Notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: M.G.R. Educational & Research Institute, Chennai, comprising (i) Thai Moogambigai Dental College and Hospital, Chennai and (ii) M.G.R. Engineering College, Maduravoyal, Chennai, were declared as Deemed to be University.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition mentioned regarding adherence to guidelines/instructions issued by UGC & AICTE?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The institutions are required to adhere to the guidelines/instructions issued by UGC & AICTE from time to time as applicable to the deemed to be university.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the Central Government permit the inclusion of ACS Medical College & Hospital, Chennai as a Constituent Institution?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government vide its Notification No.10-9/2007-U.3(A) dated 25th September, 2014 permitted the inclusion of ACS Medical College & Hospital, Chennai as a Constituent Institution.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the outcome of the Viplav Sharma's case in W.P. (C) No. 142 of 2006?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The outcome of the Viplav Sharma's case in W.P. (C) No. 142 of 2006 was pending in the Supreme Court and compliance of MCI Regulations and conditions as applicable.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the functioning of M.G.R. Educational & Research Institute, Chennai reviewed by the UGC with the help of Expert Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The functioning of M.G.R. Educational & Research Institute, Chennai and all its Constituent Unit/Institutions was reviewed by the UGC with the help of Expert Committee during 2-4th November, 2017.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Implementation of recommendations of the Seventh Central Pay Commission relating to grant of House Rent Allowance (HRA) to Central Government employees.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the rates of HRA for X, Y, and Z class cities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The rates of HRA will not be less than Rs.5,400/-, 6,000/- and 1,800/- for X, Y, and Z class cities respectively.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the revised HRA rates be for X, Y, and Z class cities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The HRA will be revised to 27%, 18%, and 9% for X, Y, and Z class cities respectively.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the revised pay structure mean?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised pay structure means the pay drawn in the pay matrix and does not include Non-Practicing Allowance (NPA), Military Service Pay (MSP), etc. or any other type of pay like special pay, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the list of cities classified as X, Y, and Z class cities for the purpose of grant of House Rent Allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The list of cities classified as X, Y, and Z class cities for the purpose of grant of House Rent Allowance is enclosed as Annexure to this order.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the special orders on continuation of HRA at Delhi, Noida, and Gurgaon?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Special orders on continuation of HRA at Delhi ('X' class city) rates to Central Government employees posted at Faridabad, Ghaziabad, Noida and Gurgaon, at Annexure 'V' class city rates.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will all other conditions governing grant of HRA under existing orders continue to apply?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, all other conditions governing grant of HRA under existing orders, shall continue to apply.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the orders apply to all civilian employees of the Central Government?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The orders will apply to all civilian employees of the Central Government, including the civilian employees paid from the Defence Service Estimates, with effect from 1st July, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the status of Armed Forces personnel and Railway employees regarding the orders?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In respect of Armed Forces personnel and Railway employees, separate orders will be issued by the Ministry of Defence and the Ministry of Railways, respectively.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is concerned with the persons serving in the Indian Audit and Accounts Department?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In so far as the persons serving in the Indian Audit and Accounts Department are concerned, these orders issue in consultation with the Comptroller & Auditor General of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Deputy Secretary Administration issuing this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Deputy Secretary Administration, for Chief Secretary to Government, Haryana, is issuing this office memorandum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is dated the 6th July, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number of this office memorandum is No.16/1/2018-1S(I).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of forwarding the information in this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The information in this office memorandum is forwarded for information and necessary action to the following in this regard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the decision taken by the Government on the recommendations made by the Seventh Central Pay Commission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Consequent upon the decision taken by the Government on the recommendations made by the Seventh Central Pay Commission, the President is pleased to decide that, in modification of this Ministry's O.M. No. 2(13)2008-E.II(B) dated 29.08.2008 and O.M. No. 2/5/2014-E.II(B) dated 21.07.2015, the admissibility of House Rent Allowance (HRA) shall be as under.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Implementation of recommendations of the Seventh Central Pay Commission relating to grant of House Rent Allowance (HRA) to Central Government employees.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the rates of HRA for X, Y, and Z class cities respectively?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The rates of HRA will not be less than Rs.5,400/-, 3,600/- and 1,800/- for X, Y, and Z class cities respectively.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the HRA be revised to for X, Y, and Z class cities respectively?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The HRA will be revised to 27%, 18%, and 9% for X, Y, and Z class cities respectively.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the revised pay structure mean?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised pay structure means the pay drawn in the pay matrix and does not include Non-Practicing Allowance (NPA), Military Service Pay (MSP), etc. or any other type of pay like special pay, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the list of cities classified as X, Y, and Z class cities for the purpose of grant of House Rent Allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The list of cities classified as X, Y, and Z class cities for the purpose of grant of House Rent Allowance is enclosed as Annexure to this order.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated 27.06.2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number is RBE No. 84/2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the previous reference number mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous reference number is No. E(P&A)I-2014/ALL/RPF-1.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The General Managers and PFAs of all Indian Railways & Production Units.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first point mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The first point states that in terms of Board's letter No. E(P&A)II-2008/ALL/RPF-3 dated 06.02.2009, Kit Maintenance Allowance @ Rs. 300/- p.m. was provided for Group 'A' officers of RPF/RPSF.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has now been decided according to the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has now been decided to extend the benefits of Kit Maintenance Allowance to Group 'A' officers of RPF/RPSF promoted on ad-hoc basis from Inspectors etc. at the same rate which is admissible to regular Group 'A' officers of RPF/RPSF for the 6th CPC period i.e. from 01.09.2008 to 30.06.2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage increase in the rates of Kit Maintenance Allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The rates of Kit Maintenance Allowance have increased by 25% every time the Dearness Allowance payable on revised pay scales goes up by 50%.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the revised rates of Kit Maintenance Allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised rates of Kit Maintenance Allowance are Rs. 375/- p.m. w.e.f. 01.01.2014 and Rs. 450/- p.m. w.e.f. 01.07.2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will this Allowance be payable till?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This Allowance shall be payable till 30.06.2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been issued regarding the subsumption of this Allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Instructions for subsumming this Allowance into a single Dress Allowance have been issued vide Board's letter No. PC-VII/2017/I/7/5/7 dated 03.10.2017 on the recommendations of 7th CPC and acceptance of Government thereto.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What other terms and conditions remain unchanged as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Other terms & conditions as mentioned in Board's letter No. E(P&A)II-2008/ALL/RPF-3 dated 06.02.2009 will remain unchanged.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: With whose concurrence has this issue been dealt with?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This issue has been dealt with the concurrence of the Finance Directorate of the Ministry of Railways.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the last instruction given in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Please acknowledge receipt.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by N.P. Singh, Joint Director/Estt.(P&A), Railway Board.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to implement the recommendations of the 6th Central Pay Commission regarding revision of rates of Uniform Allowance, Kit Maintenance Allowance and Washing Allowance for RPF/RPSF personnel.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the previous order on Kit Maintenance Allowance issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous order was issued on 06.02.2009.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the new provision for Group 'A' officers of RPF/RPSF promoted on ad-hoc basis?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They will now be eligible for Kit Maintenance Allowance at the same rate as regular Group 'A' officers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the 6th CPC period mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 6th CPC period is from 01.09.2008 to 30.06.2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage increase in Dearness Allowance that triggers a 25% increase in Kit Maintenance Allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Dearness Allowance payable on revised pay scales has to go up by 50% to trigger a 25% increase in Kit Maintenance Allowance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When were the previous revised rates of Kit Maintenance Allowance implemented?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised rates of Rs. 375/- and Rs. 450/- were implemented w.e.f. 01.01.2014 and 01.07.2014 respectively.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for subsumption of this Allowance into a single Dress Allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This is as per the recommendations of the 7th Central Pay Commission and acceptance of the Government.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which Directorate of the Ministry of Railways has concurred with this issue?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Finance Directorate of the Ministry of Railways has concurred with this issue.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of RPF and RPSF mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: RPF stands for Railway Protection Force and RPSF stands for Railway Protection Special Force.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the previous reference number mentioned in the first point of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous reference number was E(P&A)II-2008/ALL/RPF-3 dated 06.02.2009.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designation of the signatory of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The signatory is the Joint Director/Estt.(P&A), Railway Board.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of revising the Kit Maintenance Allowance rates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to implement the recommendations of the 6th Central Pay Commission.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the decision to extend the benefits of Kit Maintenance Allowance to ad-hoc Group 'A' officers taken?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This decision was taken now, as mentioned in the second point of the document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this form according to the title?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this form is to show particulars of claims by an employee for deduction of tax under section 192.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name and address of the employer mentioned in the form?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The form does not provide the name and address of the employer, as this information is to be filled in by the employee.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The form does not provide the Permanent Account Number of the employee, as this information is to be filled in by the employee.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The financial year is not mentioned in the form, as this information is to be filled in by the employee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first item listed under \"Details of claims and evidence thereof\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The first item listed is House Rent Allowance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What information is required to be provided for the House Rent Allowance claim?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The information required includes (i) Rent paid to the landlord, (ii) Name of the landlord, (iii) Address of the landlord, and (iv) Permanent Account Number of the landlord.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where should the Permanent Account Number of the landlord be provided?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Permanent Account Number of the landlord should be provided if the aggregate rent paid during the previous year exceeds one lakh rupees.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice is dated 3rd September, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of this notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number is No.F 20-5/2015 (PS).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What have the Central Government and the University Grants Commission (UGC) laid down?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government and the UGC have laid down various provisions for regulating recruitment of teachers and academic staff in universities and colleges and their career advancement in UGC funded institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the continuing vacancy position in central government funded institutions a matter of concern?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The continuing vacancy position in central government funded institutions is a matter of concern as these universities and colleges have to discharge their role as pace setting institutions in their areas of operation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Government also received recommendations regarding?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government has also received recommendations regarding the scheme of academic and research requirements governing direct recruitment and career advancement of teachers in universities and colleges.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Central Government, therefore, in larger public interest, constituted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government has, therefore, in larger public interest of attracting, retaining talented potential and selection of the most meritorious to the teaching profession, constituted a Committee under the Chairmanship of Prof. Arun Nigavekar, former Chairman, UGC to review the following:\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first point that the Committee under Prof. Arun Nigavekar has been asked to review?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Committee has been asked to review the Evaluation of the Academic Performance Indicator (API) Scheme as regards the entry point and Career Advancement of Teachers by taking into account its criticisms and suggest suitable improvements/alternatives.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second point that the Committee under Prof. Arun Nigavekar has been asked to review?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Committee has been asked to review the Evaluation of Ph.D./NET qualifications for entry of Teachers and to accordingly suggest a policy for selections.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been decided in order to take a holistic and considered view?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been decided to obtain the views of Universities, Research/Academic Institutions and the public on the above mentioned 2 points.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are all the stakeholders requested to kindly send their views/suggestions on?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All are, therefore, requested to kindly send their views/suggestions (in not more than 300 words) in the attached format, latest by 20th September, 2015 to Director (UGC), Room No. 100-A, D Wing, Shastri Bhawan-110001 or at diruqc.edu@nic.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the universities, stakeholders and individuals requested not to send in their representations?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Universities, stakeholders and individuals are requested not to send their personal grievances in their representations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Member-Convener who has signed this notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Member-Convener who has signed this notice is S. S. Sandhu.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been written at the bottom of the notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice has been forwarded to Webmaster for uploading the notice on the Ministry's website.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date written at the bottom of the notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date written at the bottom of the notice is 5.9.2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this notice is to seek views and suggestions from universities, research/academic institutions and the public on the evaluation of the Academic Performance Indicator (API) Scheme and the evaluation of Ph.D./NET qualifications for entry of teachers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for submitting the views/suggestions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deadline for submitting the views/suggestions is 20th September, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where should the views/suggestions be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The views/suggestions should be sent to the Director (UGC), Room No. 100-A, D Wing, Shastri Bhawan-110001 or at diruqc.edu@nic.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum word limit for the views/suggestions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum word limit for the views/suggestions is 300 words.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two points that the Committee under Prof. Arun Nigavekar has been asked to review?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two points are: (a) Evaluation of the Academic Performance Indicator (API) Scheme as regards the entry point and Career Advancement of Teachers, and (b) Evaluation of Ph.D./NET qualifications for entry of Teachers and to accordingly suggest a policy for selections.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has constituted the Committee under the Chairmanship of Prof. Arun Nigavekar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government has constituted the Committee under the Chairmanship of Prof. Arun Nigavekar.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of constituting the Committee under Prof. Arun Nigavekar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to review the two points mentioned in the notice.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for the Central Government to constitute this Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government has constituted this Committee in larger public interest of attracting, retaining talented potential and selection of the most meritorious to the teaching profession.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Government also received recommendations regarding?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government has also received recommendations regarding the scheme of academic and research requirements governing direct recruitment and career advancement of teachers in universities and colleges.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the matter of concern as mentioned in the notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The continuing vacancy position in central government funded institutions is a matter of concern as these universities and colleges have to discharge their role as pace setting institutions in their areas of operation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first point that the Committee has been asked to review?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Committee has been asked to review the Evaluation of the Academic Performance Indicator (API) Scheme as regards the entry point and Career Advancement of Teachers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second point that the Committee has been asked to review?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Committee has been asked to review the Evaluation of Ph.D./NET qualifications for entry of Teachers and to accordingly suggest a policy for selections.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are requested to kindly send their views/suggestions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All are, therefore, requested to kindly send their views/suggestions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the format in which the views/suggestions should be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The views/suggestions should be sent in the attached format.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mode of sending the views/suggestions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The views/suggestions can be sent either to the Director (UGC), Room No. 100-A, D Wing, Shastri Bhawan-110001 or at diruqc.edu@nic.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice is dated 3rd September, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of this notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number is No.F 20-5/2015 (PS).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Central Government and the University Grants Commission (UGC) laid down?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government and the UGC have laid down various provisions for regulating recruitment of teachers and academic staff in universities and colleges.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the continuing vacancy position in central government funded institutions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The continuing vacancy position in central government funded institutions is a matter of concern as these universities and colleges have to discharge their role as pace setting institutions in their areas of operation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Government also received recommendations regarding?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government has also received recommendations regarding the scheme of academic and research requirements governing direct recruitment and career advancement of teachers in universities and colleges.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Central Government, therefore, in larger public interest of attracting, retaining talented, potential and selection of the most meritorious to the teaching profession, constituted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government has constituted a Committee under the Chairmanship of Prof. Arun Nigavekar, former Chairman, UGC to review the following:\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first point that the Committee is tasked to review?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Committee is tasked to review the Evaluation of the Academic Performance Indicator (API) Scheme as regards the entry point and Career Advancement of Teachers by taking into account its criticisms and suggest suitable improvements/alternatives.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second point that the Committee is tasked to review?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Committee is tasked to review the Evaluation of Ph.D./NET qualifications for entry of Teachers and to accordingly suggest a policy for selections.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been decided in order to take a holistic and considered view?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been decided to obtain the views of Universities, Research/Academic Institutions and the public on the above mentioned 2 points.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are all the stakeholders requested to kindly send their views/suggestions on?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All are requested to kindly send their views/suggestions (in not more than 300 words) in the attached format, latest by 20th September, 2015 to Director (UGC), Room No. 100-A, D Wing, Shastri Bhawan-110001 or at diruec.edu@nic.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the universities, stakeholders and individuals requested not to send in their representations?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The universities, stakeholders and individuals are requested not to send their personal grievances in their representations.

(Pay-II) dated 17th June, 2010, as amended from time to time.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How should the application be submitted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is requested that the application (in duplicate) of suitable, willing and eligible officers, who can be spared immediately on selection, may be sent in the enclosed proforma (Annexure-II) to the undersigned within 45 days from the date of issue of this Office Memorandum or from the date of publication of this Office Memorandum in the Employment News/Rozgar Samachar, whichever is later.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What documents need to be submitted along with the application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (1) Dossiers of all Confidential Reports or Photostat copies of ACRs of the applicant for the last 5 years i.e. 2013-14 to 2017-

question_answer_pairs.question: Each page of Photostat copies of ACRs should be duly attested by a Group \"A\" Gazetted Officer.\n11. What other documents need to be submitted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (2) Vigilance clearance certificate to the effect that no disciplinary/vigilance case is either pending or being contemplated against the officer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What else needs to be submitted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (3) A statement showing major or minor penalties, if any, imposed on the applicant during the last 10 years. (If no penalty has been imposed, a 'NIL' certificate should be enclosed).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What else is required for the application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (4) Cadre clearance in respect of the applicant.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens if the application is received after the closing date or without the dossier of Confidential Reports?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Applications received after the closing date or without the dossier of Confidential Reports or ACRs or without recommendation of the concerned officer or otherwise found incomplete are liable to be rejected.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The deadline to submit applications is within 45 days from the date of issue of this Office Memorandum or from the date of publication of this Office Memorandum in the Employment News/Rozgar Samachar, whichever is later.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What documents need to be submitted along with the application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The required documents include dossiers of all Confidential Reports or Photostat copies of ACRs, vigilance clearance certificate, statement of penalties, and cadre clearance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens if the application is incomplete or received after the deadline?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Applications received after the closing date or without the required documents are liable to be rejected.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Can candidates withdraw their application after submitting it?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Yes, officers who apply for the post will be allowed to withdraw their candidature subsequently.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the correctness of the information provided in the application be verified?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It may be verified and certified that the particulars furnished by the officer are correct.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen if the officer is selected for the position?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In the event of selection for appointment, the officer concerned will be immediately relieved of his/her duties.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Consideration of projects for environmental clearance based on Comprehensive Environmental Pollution Index (CEPI) - Lifting of Moratorium in respect of industrial clusters/areas.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which industrial clusters/areas are mentioned in the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The industrial clusters/areas mentioned are Asansole (West Bengal), Dhanbad (Jharkhand), Haldia (West Bengal), Howrah (West Bengal), Korba (Chhattisgarh), Manpur (U.P.), Manali (Tamilnadu) and Vishakhapatnam (Andhra Pradesh).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the previous office memorandum that had imposed a moratorium on these industrial clusters/areas?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous office memorandum dated 13.1.2010 had imposed a moratorium up to 31.8.2010 on consideration of projects for environmental clearance in these industrial clusters/areas.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of lifting the moratorium on these industrial clusters/areas?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose was to consider projects for environmental clearance in these industrial clusters/areas.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How was the status of preparation of action plans reviewed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The status of preparation of action plans was reviewed in the Ministry of Environment & Forests from time to time, based on the inputs received from Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What were the details of the industrial clusters/areas further specified in the office memorandum dated 15
question_answer_pairs.answer: The details of the industrial clusters/areas were further specified in the office memorandum dated 15.3.2010.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the CPCB conducting monitoring in the Critically Polluted Areas (CPAs) during February-April 2013?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The CPCB conducted monitoring in the CPAs during February-April 2013 to re-assess the CEPI score.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the CPCB's site-to-site communication, dated July 24, 2013?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The CPCB's site-to-site communication, dated July 24, 2013, informed MoEF about the revised CEPI score based on the monitoring conducted.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which 7 areas were evaluated for the CEPI score?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 7 areas evaluated for the CEPI score were Bhiwadi (Rajasthan), Dhanbad (Jharkhand), Manali (Tamilnadu), Ahmedabad (Gujarat), Korba (Chhattisgarh), Asansole (West Bengal) and Vapi (Gujarat).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the status of the CEPI score in these 7 areas?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The evaluation of the CEPI score in these 7 areas showed that the CEPI score in 10 areas namely Bhiwadi (Rajasthan), Dhanbad (Jharkhand), Manali (Tamilnadu), Ahmedabad (Gujarat), Korba (Chhattisgarh), Asansole (West Bengal) and Vapi (Gujarat) was still in place.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the period for which the moratorium was extended as per the previous office memorandums?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The moratorium was extended up to 31st March, 2012 and thereafter it was extended till further orders vide OM of even no. dated 30.03.2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the period for which the moratorium was extended as per this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In this remaining, the moratorium was extended upto 15th February, 2011.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The CPCB conducted monitoring in the CPAs to re-assess the CEPI score.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference for this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This office Proc.Even No., Dt. 23-10-2018\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the workshop conducted on 31-10-2018?
question_answer_pairs.answer: For getting best scoring in ensuing SSC Public Examinations March-2019\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who conducted the workshop on 31-10-2018?
question_answer_pairs.answer: APREI Society, Guntur-Academic(I)\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where was the workshop conducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: APR School (M.B), Guntur\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of downloading the study material from the Society website?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To prepare the students of X class for achieving 10/10 GPA, 100% results and to avoid failures in ensuing SSC Public Examinations March-2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the Principals of APR Schools directed to do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Inform all the X class dealing subject teachers to download the study material from the Society website for preparing the students.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the Principals of APR Schools also directed to do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Obtain the self declaration from the concerned subject teacher stating that he/she downloaded the study material from the Society website and submit the same to this office.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason given for the Principals of APR Schools not downloading the study material?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Some of the Principals of APR Schools have not downloaded the study material and not conducted the special drive to the X class students.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: To get best scoring in the upcoming SSC Public Examinations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the conference held on 3rd July, 2020?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The conference was held by the Power and Renewable Energy Ministers of States & UTs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who was the chairperson of the conference?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The conference was held under the chairmanship of the Hon'ble Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Power and New & Renewable Energy.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What challenges was the nation facing during the conference?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The nation was facing multiple challenges on account of the COVID-19 pandemic.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How did the power sector respond to the challenges during the pandemic?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The power sector fraternity was working tirelessly in ensuring uninterrupted power supply to all, especially hospitals and other essential establishments, during these challenging times.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What event did the Secretary (Power) mention regarding the grid stability?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Secretary (Power) expressed concern at the fragile financial health of the State DISCOMs and the 'lights off' event on 05.04.2020.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the aggregate ACS-ARR gap of the State DISCOMs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aggregate ACS-ARR gap continued to be negative despite significant investments in infrastructure; it was about Rs.0.72 Paise per unit in 2018-19.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What were the aggregate annual losses of the State DISCOMs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aggregate annual losses of State DISCOMs mounted to more than Rs. 85,000 crore in year 2018-19.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the status of the aggregate net-worth of DISCOMs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aggregate net-worth of DISCOMs is negative.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How did the pandemic affect the financial stress in the power sector?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pandemic may exacerbate the financial stress in the power sector.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What measures were discussed to address the perennial ills of the power sector?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The participants were urged to use this crisis as an opportunity to take bold measures to address some of the perennial ills of the sector.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What positive development did the Hon'ble Minister mention about the power sector?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Hon'ble Minister stated that the power sector had seen a quantum jump in access to electricity, from very high energy deficit scenario to energy surplus condition.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the status of village electrification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 100% village electrification and near 100% electricity access to households has been achieved.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How has the transmission system been strengthened?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The transmission system has also been strengthened and the nation is now connected into one grid in which electricity can be transmitted from one region to another without any congestion.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the biggest challenge faced by the DISCOMs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: DISCOMs' health remains the biggest challenge.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How much debt did the DISCOMs owe to GENCOs and Transmission companies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: DISCOMs owed Rs.2.25 lakh crore to GENCOs and Transmission companies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What impact did this debt have on the finances of the power sector?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This has a cascading effect on the finances of the power sector.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How did the debt impact the ability of DISCOMs to supply 24x7 quality power?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It also impairs the ability of DISCOMs to supply 24x7 quality supply.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What reforms were discussed to enhance the sustainability of the power sector?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Reforms are essential to enhance the sustainability of the sector.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What agenda items were briefly dwelt upon during the conference?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The agenda items of the conference were briefly dwelt upon.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: On what date was the 'lights off' event mentioned by the Secretary (Power)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 'lights off' event was on 05.04.2020.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the aggregate ACS-ARR gap of the State DISCOMs in 2018-19?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aggregate ACS-ARR gap was about Rs.0.72 Paise per unit in 2018-19.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the total annual loss of the State DISCOMs in 2018-19?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aggregate annual losses of State DISCOMs mounted to more than Rs. 85,000 crore in year 2018-19.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the status of the aggregate net-worth of DISCOMs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aggregate net-worth of DISCOMs is negative.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The power sector had seen a quantum jump in access to electricity, from very high energy deficit scenario to energy surplus condition.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What percentage of village electrification has been achieved?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 100% village electrification and near 100% electricity access to households has been achieved.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How has the transmission system been strengthened?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The transmission system has also been strengthened and the nation is now connected into one grid in which electricity can be transmitted from one region to another without any congestion.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: DISCOMs owed Rs.2.25 lakh crore to GENCOs and Transmission companies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the cascading effect of this debt on the finances of the power sector?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This has a cascading effect on the finances of the power sector.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Reforms are essential to enhance the sustainability of the sector.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the conference held on 3rd July, 2020?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The conference was held for the Power and Renewable Energy Ministers of States & UTs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who was the chairperson of the conference?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The conference was held under the chairmanship of the Hon'ble Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Power and New & Renewable Energy.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What challenges did the conference address regarding power supply during the COVID-19 pandemic?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The conference discussed ensuring uninterrupted power supply to all, especially hospitals and other essential establishments, during the challenging times of the COVID-19 pandemic.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the concern expressed about the financial health of the State DISCOMs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Secretary (Power) expressed concern about the fragile financial health of the State DISCOMs, whose aggregate ACS-ARR gap continued to be negative despite significant investments in infrastructure.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What were the aggregate annual losses of the State DISCOMs in 2018-19?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aggregate annual losses of the State DISCOMs mounted to more than Rs. 85,000 crore in the year 2018-19.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How did the pandemic affect the financial stress in the power sector?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pandemic could exacerbate the financial stress in the power sector, and the participants were urged to use this crisis as an opportunity to take bold measures to address some of the perennial ills of the sector.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the quantum jump seen in access to electricity?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Hon'ble Minister stated that the power sector had seen a quantum jump in access to electricity, from very high energy deficit scenario to energy surplus condition.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the level of village electrification achieved?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 100% village electrification and near 100% electricity access to households was achieved.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How has the transmission system been strengthened?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The transmission system has been strengthened, and the nation is now connected into one grid in which electricity can be transmitted from one region to another without any congestion.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the biggest challenge faced by the DISCOMs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: DISCOMs' health remains the biggest challenge. As on 31.3.2020, DISCOMs owed Rs.2.25 lakh crore to GENCOs and Transmission companies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the financial stress of DISCOMs affect the power sector?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The financial stress of DISCOMs has a cascading effect on the finances of the power sector. It also impairs the ability of DISCOMs to supply 24x7 quality supply.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government of India, Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, GST Policy Wing\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the circular addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Principal Chief Commissioners/ Chief Commissioners / Principal Commissioners / Commissioners of Central Tax (All), The Principal Directors General / Directors General (All), and The Principal CCA, CBIC.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Clarification on certain issues related to refund - Reg.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To clarify certain issues relating to refund and to ensure uniformity in the implementation of the provisions of law across the field formations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the legal basis for this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is issued in exercise of the powers conferred by section 168 (1) of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the status of refund claim after issuance of deficiency memo and re-credit of electronic credit ledger?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular clarifies the intent of law in cases where a deficiency memo is issued in respect of a refund claim.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the intent of law regarding deficiency memo and refund application as per the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular clarifies that in cases where refund application is not re-submitted after the issuance of a deficiency memo, the amount debited from the electronic credit ledger is required to be re-credited.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the form number mentioned in the circular for refund application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: FORM GST RFD-04/06\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: FORM GST RFD-03\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens once a deficiency memo has been issued against an application for refund?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular clarifies that once a deficiency memo has been issued against an application for refund, the amount debited from the electronic credit ledger is required to be re-credited.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which circular is referred to in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Circular No. 59/33/2018-GST dated the 4th September, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Para 7.2 of the said circular elaborates on the practice being followed in the field formations and clarifies the issues as detailed therein.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is dated 23rd October, 2000.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the office memorandum is \"Review and filling up of vacant posts.\"\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What instructions are mentioned regarding the filling up of vacant posts?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The instructions stipulate that every Ministry/Department shall undertake a review of all the posts which are lying vacant in the Ministry/Department and in the attached and subordinate offices.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition for filling up the vacant posts?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The vacant posts shall not be filled up except with the approval of the Ministry of Finance (Department of Expenditure).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the guideline regarding the duration of the vacant posts?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The guidelines state that the vacancies by direct recruitment and other modes are concerned, proposals in this regard may continue to be referred to Ministry of Finance (Department of Expenditure) for approval if these vacancies are less than one year old.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference to the previous office memorandum mentioned in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference is made to the Department's O.M. of even No. dated 5.8.1999 communicating certain guidelines on austerity/economy in expenditure.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the posts which are lying vacant for more than one year?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Further, with regard to posts which are lying vacant for more than one year, the instructions contained in Department's O.M. No.7(4)/E.Coord/2000 dated September 24, 2000 regarding abolition of such posts may be strictly complied with.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is signed by the Joint Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is addressed to All Ministries/Departments and All FAs (by name).\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this office memorandum is to provide guidelines for the review and filling up of vacant posts in various Ministries/Departments.\n
