question_answer_pairs.answer: Clarification regarding reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service in respect of Gangmen and staff working in safety category posts with 1800 GP under LARSGESS Scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government ministry issued this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is issued by the Ministry of Railways, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the signatory of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by K. Shankar, Director Estt. (P&A), Railway Board.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated 11-03-2013.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number of this document is No. E(P&A)I-2011/RT-6.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this document is to provide clarification regarding the reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service in respect of Gangmen and staff working in safety category posts with 1800 GP under LARSGESS Scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the LARSGESS Scheme mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: LARSGESS stands for the Liberalized Active Retirement Scheme for Guaranteed Employment for Safety Staff.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who had raised the issue regarding the reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service?
question_answer_pairs.answer: NFIR (National Federation of Indian Railwaymen) had raised the issue regarding the reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the issue raised by NFIR?
question_answer_pairs.answer: NFIR had raised the issue regarding the reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service in respect of those staff who have rendered service in both non-safety and safety category posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How has the issue been examined and resolved?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The issue has been examined in the Board's Office, and it is clarified that 20 years' of qualifying service should be in the specified safety category posts indicated in the list annexed with Board's letter No. E(P&A)I-2010/RT-2 dated 11.09.2010, 28.06.2011 and 03.01.2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the dates mentioned in the document regarding the list of safety category posts?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The list of safety category posts is annexed with Board's letter No. E(P&A)I-2010/RT-2 dated 11.09.2010, 28.06.2011 and 03.01.2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the \"General Managers\" mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The General Managers refer to the General Managers of all Indian Railways.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main purpose of this document is to provide clarification regarding the reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service for Gangmen and staff working in safety category posts under the LARSGESS Scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the LARSGESS Scheme mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: LARSGESS stands for the Liberalized Active Retirement Scheme for Guaranteed Employment for Safety Staff.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the intended audience of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The intended audience of this document are the General Managers of all Indian Railways.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key issue that has been addressed in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The key issue addressed in this document is the reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service for Gangmen and staff working in safety category posts under the LARSGESS Scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the background of the issue mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: NFIR had raised the issue regarding the reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service in respect of those staff who have rendered service in both non-safety and safety category posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How has the issue been resolved as per this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The issue has been examined in the Board's Office, and it is clarified that 20 years' of qualifying service should be in the specified safety category posts indicated in the list annexed with Board's letter No. E(P&A)I-2010/RT-2 dated 11.09.2010, 28.06.2011 and 03.01.2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the LARSGESS Scheme mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The LARSGESS Scheme is a Liberalized Active Retirement Scheme for Guaranteed Employment for Safety Staff.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is responsible for implementing the clarification provided in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The General Managers of all Indian Railways are responsible for implementing the clarification provided in this document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the Board's letter mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board's letter is dated 11.09.2010, 28.06.2011 and 03.01.2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of the Board's letter mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number of the Board's letter is E(P&A)I-2010/RT-2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the safety category posts mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 20 years' of qualifying service should be in the specified safety category posts indicated in the list annexed with the Board's letter.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Director Estt
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Director Estt. (P&A) is K. Shankar, who has signed the document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the clarification provided in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the clarification is to provide guidance on the reckoning of 20 years' of qualifying service for Gangmen and staff working in safety category posts under the LARSGESS Scheme.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the course code for Computer Science?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The course code for Computer Science is 083.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two programming language options mentioned for this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two programming language options mentioned are Python and C++.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first learning objective of this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The first learning objective is to understand the basics of computers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second learning objective of this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The second learning objective is to develop logic for Problem Solving.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the third learning objective of this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The third learning objective is to develop problem-solving skills and their implementation through Python (version 2.7) or to implement them using C++.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fourth learning objective of this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The fourth learning objective is to understand and implement the concept of Object Oriented Methodology.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fifth learning objective of this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The fifth learning objective is to understand the concept of working with Relational Database.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the sixth learning objective of this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The sixth learning objective is to understand the basic concept of Computing Logic.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the seventh learning objective of this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The seventh learning objective is to understand the basic concepts of Communication and Networking technologies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eighth learning objective of this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eighth learning objective is to understand Open Source Software.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the unit name for Unit No. 1?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The unit name for Unit No. 1 is COMPUTER FUNDAMENTALS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the unit name for Unit No. 2?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The unit name for Unit No. 2 is PROGRAMMING METHODOLOGY.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the unit name for Unit No. 3?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The unit name for Unit No. 3 is INTRODUCTION TO PYTHON.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the unit name for Unit No. 4?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The unit name for Unit No. 4 is PROGRAMMING WITH PYTHON.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many theory and practical periods are there for Unit 1
question_answer_pairs.answer: COMPUTER FUNDAMENTALS? : There are 18 theory and 6 practical periods for Unit 1: COMPUTER FUNDAMENTALS.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the topics covered under Software concepts in Unit 1?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The topics covered under Software concepts in Unit 1 are Types of Software - System Software, Utility Software and Application Software.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the topics covered under Operating System in Unit 1?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The topics covered under Operating System in Unit 1 are Need for Operating System, Functions of Operating System (Process Management, Memory Management, File Management, and Device Management), and Commonly used operating systems like Windows, Solaris, BOSS (Bharat Operating System Solutions), Mobile OS, Android, Linux.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the topics covered under Utility Software in Unit 1?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The topics covered under Utility Software in Unit 1 are Disk Management tools, Compression tools and Disk Management tools (Disk Cleanup, Disk Defragmenter, Backup).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the topics covered under Open Source Concepts in Unit 1?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The topics covered under Open Source Concepts in Unit 1 are Open Source Software, Freeware, Shareware, Proprietary Software.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the topics covered under Application Software in Unit 1?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The topics covered under Application Software in Unit 1 are Office Tools - Word Processor, Presentation Tool, Spreadsheet Package, Database Management System, Domain Specific tools, School Management System, Inventory Management System, Payroll System, Financial Accounting, Hotel Management, Reservation System and Weather Forecasting System.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is Circular No. 18/18/2017-GST and the date is 16th November 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government department issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular was issued by the Government of India, Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, Tax Research Unit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Clarification on refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs in respect of exporters of fabrics.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the doubts that have been raised regarding the restrictions of refund of unutilized input tax credit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Doubts have been raised regarding the restrictions of refund of unutilized input tax credit to 35 and 60 and headings 5608, 5801, 5806 under GST.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which section of the CGST Act, 2017 provides the details mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Subsection 3 of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 provides the details mentioned in this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, who can claim refund of any unutilized input tax credit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A registered person may claim refund of any unutilized input tax credit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two conditions mentioned where the refund of unutilized input tax credit shall not be allowed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) zero rated supplies without payment of tax, and (ii) where the credit has accumulated on account of rate of tax on inputs being higher than the rate of tax on output supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis for the recommendations of the GST Council mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The recommendations of the GST Council, Notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax(Rate) dated 28.06.2017 have been the basis for the details mentioned in this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 that has been referred to in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 restricting refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs in respect of certain specified goods has been referred to.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the notification number and date that has been mentioned in this circular regarding the CGST Act, 2017?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax(Rate) dated 28.06.2017 has been mentioned.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clause of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 that has been mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Clause (ii) of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 has been mentioned.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the restriction on refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs that has been mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The restriction is that the refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs will not be applicable to zero rated supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to provide clarification on refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs in respect of exporters of fabrics.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to the Principal Chief Commissioners/Chief Commissioners/Principal Commissioners/Commissioners and The Principal Director Generals/Director Generals (All).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the location mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is issued from North Block, New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is dated 16th November 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the F
question_answer_pairs.answer: The F. No. mentioned is 354/320/2017-TRU-Pt.I.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which Act is referred to in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The CGST Act, 2017 is referred to in this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the section number of the CGST Act, 2017 that is mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 is mentioned in this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subsection number of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 that is mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Subsection 3 of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 is mentioned.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two types of zero rated supplies mentioned in the circular where refund of unutilized input tax credit shall not be allowed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) zero rated supplies without payment of tax, and (ii) where the credit has accumulated on account of rate of tax on inputs being higher than the rate of tax on output supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax(Rate) dated 28.06.2017 is mentioned.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clause of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 that restricts refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Clause (ii) of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 restricts refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason mentioned in the circular for the restriction on refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason is that the refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs will not be applicable to zero rated supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the context in which the notification issued under clause (ii) of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 has been mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notification has been mentioned in the context of restricting refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs in respect of certain specified goods.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clause of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 that has been referred to in the last paragraph of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Clause (ii) of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 has been referred to.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the restriction mentioned in the last paragraph of the circular regarding refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The restriction is that the refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs will not be applicable to zero rated supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the last paragraph of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the last paragraph is to reiterate the restriction on refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs that will not be applicable to zero rated supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the overall purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The overall purpose of this circular is to provide clarification on the refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs in respect of exporters of fabrics.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is Circular No. 18/18/2017-GST and the date is 16th November 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular was issued by the Government of India, Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, Tax Research Unit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Clarification on refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs in respect of exporters of fabrics.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the doubts that have been raised regarding the restrictions of refund of unutilized input tax credit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Doubts have been raised regarding the restrictions of refund of unutilized input tax credit to 35 and 60 and headings 5608, 5801, 5806 under GST.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which section of the CGST Act, 2017 provides the details mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Subsection 3 of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 provides the details mentioned in this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, who can claim refund of any unutilized input tax credit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A registered person may claim refund of any unutilized input tax credit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two conditions mentioned where the refund of unutilized input tax credit shall not be allowed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) zero rated supplies without payment of tax, and (ii) where the credit has accumulated on account of rate of tax on inputs being higher than the rate of tax on output supplies.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The recommendations of the GST Council, Notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax(Rate) dated 28.06.2017 have been the basis for the details mentioned in this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 that has been referred to in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 restricting refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs in respect of certain specified goods has been referred to.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the notification number and date that has been mentioned in this circular regarding the amendment to the CGST Act, 2017?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax(Rate) dated 28.06.2017 has been mentioned.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, which clause of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017 has been issued under clause (ii) of the proviso?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notification having been issued under clause (ii) of the proviso to sub-section (3) of section 54 of the CGST Act, 2017, restriction on refund of unutilized input tax credit of GST paid on inputs will not be applicable to zero rated supplies.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide instructions to examiners regarding the qualifying sea service requirements for Marine Engineer Officer Class II.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many months of approved sea service is required as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that the approved sea service required is not less than twelve months.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designation of the officer mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officer is referred to as Assistant Engineer Officer or Officer in charge of an engineering watch.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the power requirement for the machinery operated by the Assistant Engineer Officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The power requirement is 750 KW or more.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the requirement specified as \"12 months approved sea service as OIC EW\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to avoid any undue delay to the candidates for eligibility.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has decided that all candidates submitting testimonial for sea service to appear for Marine Engineer Officer Class II examination should have served as Officer in charge of an engineering watch on ships powered by main propulsion machinery of 750 KW power or more?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chief Examiner of Engineers has decided this.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis for the requirement of 12 months approved sea service as OIC EW?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The basis is as per the flow diagram No. 3 on page III/12 of Rule 22/2(i) of Chapter III of MS (STCW) Rules 1998.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the policy regarding the change of an engineering watch?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The policy is that the change of an engineering watch may be given as per the company's policy.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has approved the issues mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The issues have been approved by the Chief Examiner of Engineers.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document mentions First/Second/Third Assistants and in some cases, they are designated as Second/Third/Fourth Engineer Officer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the \"Nature of Duties\" column?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to inform the candidates who have been given as \"Assistant to watch keeper\" in the testimonial for sea service.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for candidates submitting testimonial for sea service to appear for Marine Engineer Officer Class II examination?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They should have served as Officer in charge of an engineering watch on ships powered by main propulsion machinery of 750 KW power or more.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis for the requirement of 12 months approved sea service as OIC EW?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The basis is as per the flow diagram No. 3 on page III/12 of Rule 22/2(i) of Chapter III of MS (STCW) Rules 1998.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the \"Shipping companies follow different designations for their officers\" statement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to inform that different shipping companies use different designations for their officers, such as First/Second/Third Assistants and in some cases, Second/Third/Fourth Engineer Officer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the statement \"there have been cases where candidates who have performed the duties as 'in charge of watch' have been given as 'Assistant to watch keeper' in the testimonial for sea service\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to inform that some candidates have been given the designation of 'Assistant to watch keeper' in their testimonial, even though they have performed the duties of 'in charge of watch'.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the statement \"in order to avoid any undue delay to the candidates for eligibility\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to ensure that candidates are not unduly delayed in their eligibility to appear for the Marine Engineer Officer Class II examination.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the statement \"the Chief Examiner of Engineers have now decided that all candidates submitting testimonial for sea service to appear for Marine Engineer Officer Class II examination should have served as Officer in charge of an engineering watch on ships powered by main propulsion machinery of 750 KW power or more\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to clarify the requirement for candidates to have served as Officer in charge of an engineering watch on ships with a certain power requirement in order to be eligible for the Marine Engineer Officer Class II examination.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the statement \"Rule 22/2(i) of Chapter III of MS (STCW) Rules 1998 to be read as 'should not be less than twelve months as Officer in charge of an engineering watch'\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to clarify the requirement for the duration of approved sea service as Officer in charge of an engineering watch.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the statement \"the officers may be given as per the company's policy\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to inform that the designation of the officers may be given as per the policy of the shipping company.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the qualifying sea service requirement mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The qualifying sea service requirement has already been stipulated in the STCW Manual, and the approved sea going service required by Rule 22(2)(d) of Chapter II of MS (STCW) Rules 1998 should not be less than twelve months.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement specified as \"12 months approved sea service as OIC EW\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The requirement specified is \"12 months approved sea service as OIC EW\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How do shipping companies follow different designations for their officers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Shipping companies follow different designations for their officers, such as First/Second/Third Assistants and in some cases, they are designated as Second/Third/Fourth Engineer Officer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the decision taken by the Chief Examiner of Engineers regarding the candidates submitting testimonial for sea service to appear for Marine Engineer Officer Class II examination?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chief Examiner of Engineers have now decided that all candidates submitting testimonial for sea service to appear for Marine Engineer Officer Class II examination should have served as Officer in charge of an engineering watch on ships powered by main propulsion machinery of 750 KW propulsion power or more after obtaining MEO Class IV Certificate of Competency as specified in the flow diagram No. 3 on page III/2 of Rule 22(2)(d) of Chapter II of MS (STCW) Rules 1998.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The change of an engineering watch may be given as per the company's policy.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the document?
What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Finance Department - Human Resource Management - Employee Data sheet Information - Online Collection of Employees' data through Web-based application - Instructions to handle the Data - Regarding.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the data collection mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To have a comprehensive data base of all Government employees of the state and to use the data for various purposes i.e. to answer LAQs, Parliamentary Questions and to provide information under RTI Act etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will this data collection facilitate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It will also facilitate the monetary and non-monetary entitlements of the employees, assessment of vacancies, recruitment authorization and preparation of panels for promotion, issues relating to pay fixation, revisions of Pay Scales, etc., and timely payment of retirement benefits, sanction of leave, timely release of increments, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Drawing and Disbursing Officer (DDO) mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The concerned Treasury Officer (PAO) in the state shall furnish the data relating to all Government employees to the concerned Treasury Officer (PAO) in hard copy duly signed by the Drawing Officer along with the pay bills for the month of February 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the responsibility of the individual employee as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The individual employee shall be responsible for providing the entire information relating to himself / herself by verifying the data/sheet that would be provided by the DDO, the principal responsibility for validating the information with reference to the Service Register and attesting the information in the Employee Data sheet duly ensuring its correctness is vested with the concerned DDO.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can the relevant Employee Data sheet forms be accessed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The relevant Employee Data sheet forms and user manual are available in the website \"https://fdp.cgg.gov.in\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of collecting the employee data mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To have a comprehensive data base of all Government employees of the state and to use the data for various purposes.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is responsible for validating the employee information?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The principal responsibility for validating the information with reference to the Service Register and attesting the information in the Employee Data sheet duly ensuring its correctness is vested with the concerned DDO.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for providing the employee data?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document does not mention a specific deadline for providing the employee data.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of application is used to collect the employee data?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A Web-based application developed by the Finance Department is used to collect the employee data.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of collecting the employee data through the Web-based application?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To have a comprehensive data base of all Government employees of the state and to use the data for various purposes.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What information will the collected data be used for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The data will be used to answer LAQs, Parliamentary Questions and to provide information under RTI Act, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the data collection facilitate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It will facilitate the monetary and non-monetary entitlements of the employees, assessment of vacancies, recruitment authorization and preparation of panels for promotion, issues relating to pay fixation, revisions of Pay Scales, etc., and timely payment of retirement benefits, sanction of leave, timely release of increments, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is responsible for furnishing the employee data to the concerned Treasury Officer (PAO)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The concerned Treasury Officer (PAO) in the state shall furnish the data relating to all Government employees to the concerned Treasury Officer (PAO) in hard copy duly signed by the Drawing Officer along with the pay bills for the month of February 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Drawing Officer in the data collection process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Drawing Officer along with the pay bills for the month of February 2017 shall furnish the data relating to all Government employees to the concerned Treasury Officer (PAO) in hard copy duly signed.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can the user manual for the Employee Data sheet forms be accessed?

question_answer_pairs.question:
What is the title of the document? The title of the document is NOTIFICATION.
2. Which government ministry issued this notification? The Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare issued this notification.
3. When was this notification issued? This notification was issued on the 16th August, 2016.
4. What is the purpose of this notification? The purpose of this notification is to amend the Multi-State Co-operative Societies Rules, 2002.
5. What rules are being amended by this notification? The Multi-State Co-operative Societies (Amendment) Rules, 2016 are being amended by this notification.
6. When will the amended rules come into force? The amended rules shall come into force on the date of their publication in the Official Gazette.
7. What change is being made to rule 3 of the Multi-State Co-operative Societies Rules, 2002? In rule 3, sub-rule (1), clause (i) is being substituted.
8. What is the new clause (i) being inserted in rule 3? The new clause (i) being inserted is "(b) the list of persons who have contributed to the share capital, together with the amount contributed by each of them along with their ID-address proofs duly attested by the Chief Promoter;".
9. What other new clause is being inserted after clause (i)? The new clause being inserted after clause (i) is "(i) primary multi state co-operative societies having objects and functions relating to credit or having multi-purpose objects shall be registered initially with the States or the Union Territories as a unit of operation."
10. What type of societies are required to submit additional documents? Societies having objects and functions relating to credit or having multi-purpose objects are required to submit additional documents.
11. What are the additional documents these societies are required to submit? The additional documents these societies are required to submit are
question_answer_pairs.answer: (a) an attested Certificate from the Registrar of Cooperative Societies of the states or the union territories concerned where the proposed area of operation of the society extends, and (b) a verification certificate of the background and other credentials of the Chief Promoter and Promoters duly certified by the Registrar of Cooperative Societies of the State where the Registered Office of the Society is proposed to be located.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Kayal Loan scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the Kayal Loan scheme is to provide financial assistance to farmers for cultivation of various crops.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the effective period of the Kayal Loan scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The effective period of the Kayal Loan scheme is from 01.04.2006 to 2006-07.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The objective of the Kayal Loan scheme is to increase the productivity and production of various crops.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The target group of the Kayal Loan scheme is the farmers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis for determining the loan amount?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The loan amount is determined based on the type of crop and whether it is a regular or improved variety.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum loan amount per acre for regular crops is Rs. 2500.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum loan amount per acre for improved variety crops?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum loan amount per acre for improved variety crops is Rs. 3500.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document mentions 4 types of crops - Rabi/Kharif, Horticulture, Sugarcane, and Other crops.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of providing higher loan amounts for improved variety crops?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to encourage farmers to adopt improved crop varieties to increase productivity and production.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government of India is responsible for implementing the Kayal Loan scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The target beneficiaries of the Kayal Loan scheme are the farmers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the Department of Pension and Pensioner's Welfare's OM No
question_answer_pairs.answer: The OM No. 28/2/2014-P&PW(B) dated 22.9.2014 advised that in case CCS (Pension) Rules have been adopted for new AIIMS, then the employees joining them on immediate absorption would be eligible to count their past service for pension.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the regulation mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Regulation 28 of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences Regulations, 1999, inter-alia, provides that the employees of the Institute except those on deputation shall be governed by the Central Civil Services (Pension) Rules, 1972.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Fixation of pay on promotion after 1-1-73 from the revised junior class I scale to the senior class I scale.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To refer to paragraph 3 of the Ministry's OM dated 14th September, 1975, which stipulates that the orders contained therein shall remain in force for a period of 5 years from 1-1-73.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been decided regarding the matter reviewed in the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The matter has been reviewed and it has been decided to extend the orders further by another year up to the end of 31st December, 1978 or until further orders are issued in the matter, whichever is earlier.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the post being advertised for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The post being advertised is for a Financial Advisor (at Colaba, Mumbai).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay level for the Financial Advisor post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay level is appropriate stage at Level 13 of Pay Matrix (7th Central Pay Commission).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for the Financial Advisor post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers from any Organized Finance & Accounts service of the Government of India, eligible for appointment under Non-Central Staffing Scheme are eligible for the post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum regular service requirement for the Financial Advisor post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers holding analogous posts OR with five years' regular service in Level 12 OR with 10 years' regular service in Level 11 and above are eligible.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What kind of experience is required for the Financial Advisor post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Experience in Government accounting/budgeting and financial procedures, Stores and Purchase procedures is required.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What kind of knowledge is required for the Financial Advisor post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Adequate knowledge of Government of India rules and regulations is required.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the job duties of the Financial Advisor?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Shall advise in all matters related to Finance, Accounts, Audit, Purchase, MoUs etc. of the Institute and report to the Dean, Finance; Shall be responsible for the Accounts and Audit functions of the Institute and help in the budget formulation; Is expected to bring-in requisite expertise in the Institute's financial management and maintain a good liaison with DAE and other external Agencies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum age limit for appointment on deputation basis?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum age limit for appointment by deputation basis shall be 56 years as on July 01, 2023.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the initial period of deputation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The period of deputation will be initially for three years (extendable by another two years) as per Foreign Service Terms of the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The eligible employees should send their applications through proper channel as per the application format uploaded on the TIFR website (http://www.tifr.res.in/positions).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"Notification\" from the Government of India, Ministry of Finance, Department of Economic Affairs, Budget Division.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated January 30, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to notify the auction for sale (re-issue) of 6.62 per cent Government Stock 2051.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the aggregate amount of the Government Stock 2051 being sold?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aggregate amount of the Government Stock 2051 being sold is ₹2,900 crore (nominal).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the Stock be sold?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Stock will be sold through the Reserve Bank of India, Mumbai Office, Fort, Mumbai-400 001 in the manner as prescribed in paragraph 5.1 of the General Notification F. No. 4 (13)-W&M/2008, dated October 8, 2008.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the method of issue for the Stock?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Stock will be sold through a price based multiple price auction method.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the eligible bidders for the Non-competitive Bidding Facility?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notified amount of the sale will be allotted to eligible individuals and institutions as per the enclosed Scheme for Non-competitive Bidding Facility.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When and where will the auction be conducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The auction will be conducted by the Reserve Bank of India at its Mumbai Office, Fort, Mumbai-400 001 on February 03, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the timeline for submitting bids for the auction?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Bids for the auction should be submitted in electronic format on the Reserve Bank of India Core Banking Solution (E-Kuber) system on February 03, 2017, between 10:30 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the \"When Issued\" trading for the Stock commence?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Stock will be eligible for \"When Issued\" trading in accordance with the guidelines issued by the Reserve Bank of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the tenure of the Government Stock?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government Stock will have a tenure of 35 years commencing from November 28, 2016.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the Stock be redeemed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Stock will be redeemed at par on November 28, 2051.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the result of the auction be displayed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The result of the auction shall be displayed by the Reserve Bank of India at its Fort, Mumbai Office on February 03, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the payment for the Stock be made?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The payment for the Stock will be made on February 06, 2017, as per the terms and conditions specified in the notification.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the interest rate on the Stock?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The interest at the rate of 6.62 per cent per annum will accrue on the nominal value of the Stock from the date of original issue and will be paid half yearly on May 28 and November 28.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Prime Minister's Special Scholarship Scheme (PMSSS)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is a scheme instituted by the Government of India to provide better opportunities and enhance the potential for better employment to the youth belonging to the State of J&K.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the objective of the PMSSS scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The objective is to provide scholarships to students who perform meritoriously at higher secondary school level and are desirous of pursuing undergraduate studies in various colleges and institutes located outside their domiciled state.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How much is the scholarship amount per annum in the General, Professional & Medical Streams?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The scholarship amount is Rs. 30,000/- per annum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How much is the scholarship amount per annum in the Regulatory Committee prescribed by the State Fee Regulatory Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The scholarship amount is less than or equal to Rs. 3.00 Lakh per annum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maintenance allowance provided to the students?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maintenance allowance is Rs.0.10 Lakh per annum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the first installment of the scholarship be released?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The first installment of Rs.20,000/- will be released immediately on verification of joining report by the Institute.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the amount of the Remaining Flight (8) installments?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The remaining 8 installments of Rs.10,000/- each will be released on monthly basis subject to online verification of student's attendance by the concerned Institute.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will the colleges and the students receive the scholarship amount from?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The scholarship amount will be released directly into their respective accounts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Are the students required to pay any academic fees, except refundable security deposits and hostel/mess fees?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, the colleges are requested not to ask the students to pay any academic fees, except refundable security deposits and hostel/mess fees.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the counseling for admission under the Scheme commence for the current academic session 2019-20?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The counseling has already commenced from 15th June, 2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where have the students been allotted institutions through the counseling process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The students have been allotted institutions in New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the students required to do after being allotted an institution?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The students have been given strict instructions to report to their allotted institution within specified date.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the email address provided in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The email address provided is chairman@aicte-india.org.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the website address provided in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The website address provided is www.aicte-india.org.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of AICTE mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: AICTE stands for All India Council for Technical Education.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry of the Government of India has entrusted the task of implementation of PMSSS to AICTE?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India has entrusted the task of implementation of PMSSS to AICTE.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the beneficiaries of the PMSSS scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The beneficiaries are the students belonging to the State of J&K.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the PMSSS scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide better opportunities and enhance the potential for better employment to the youth belonging to the State of J&K.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many streams are mentioned in the document for the scholarship amount?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Three streams are mentioned - General, Professional & Medical.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum scholarship amount per annum prescribed by the State Fee Regulatory Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum scholarship amount is less than or equal to Rs. 3.00 Lakh per annum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the remaining 8 installments of Rs
question_answer_pairs.answer: The remaining 8 installments will be released on monthly basis subject to online verification of student's attendance by the concerned Institute.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will the colleges and the students receive the scholarship amount from directly?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The colleges and the students will receive the scholarship amount directly into their respective accounts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first installment amount that will be released immediately on verification of joining report?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The first installment is Rs.20,000/-.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total number of installments for the scholarship amount?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There are 9 installments in total - the first installment of Rs.20,000/- and the remaining 8 installments of Rs.10,000/- each.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maintenance allowance provided to the students per annum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maintenance allowance is Rs.0.10 Lakh per annum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the organization that issued this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is issued by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Location of Toll Plazas on National Highways - reg.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To convey that toll plaza locations recommended by the DPR consultants should be in accordance with the provisions of the National Highways Fee (Determination of Rates and Collection) Rules, 2008.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the issuing authority of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (Highways Section), Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 5th September 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the location of the issuing authority?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Parivahan Bhavan 1, Sansad Marg, New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the guidelines that shall be followed for NH projects to be awarded in future?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Toll plaza locations recommended by the DPR consultants, obtaining concurrence of the concerned State Government(s) regarding the locations of toll plazas, and the concerned State Government providing an undertaking to continuously support the toll fees collection and compensate for any disruption.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement regarding the Terms of Reference (ToR) for the DPR consultants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The toll plaza locations recommended by the DPR consultants shall be suitably made a part of the Terms of Reference (ToR).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the project execution authorities regarding the locations of toll plazas?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Obtain the concurrence of the concerned State Government(s) regarding the locations of toll plazas before inviting bids or declaring \"Appointed Dates\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the concerned State Government regarding the toll fees collection and compensation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Provide an undertaking to continuously support the toll fees collection and compensate for any disruption.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to convey the continuation of the Interest Subvention Scheme for Short Term Crop Loans during the years 2018-19 and 2019-20.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The interest subvention rate offered is 2% per annum.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Public Sector Banks (PSBs) and Private Sector Commercial Banks are eligible.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How is the interest subvention calculated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 2% interest subvention will be calculated on the crop loan amount from the date of its disbursement/drawl up to the date of actual repayment of the crop loan by the farmer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to inform that the ongoing Plan Scheme National Child Labour Project for elimination of Child Labour is being reviewed to bring about structural changes for realignment of the scheme with the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who had been constituted in this regard?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A working group consisting of members from various Ministries and State Governments had been constituted in this regard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the State Labour Secretaries Meeting take place?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The State Labour Secretaries Meeting took place on 30.01.2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the status of the process of finalization and issue of the revised guidelines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The process of finalization and issue of the revised guidelines in accordance with the recommendations is underway.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Until when is the operation of the National Child Labour Project Scheme (NCLPS) extended?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The operation of the NCLPS is hereby extended till the revised guidelines are issued or till 30.09.2014, whichever is earlier.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of this Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The recipients are All State Principal Secretaries (Labour), District Magistrates/Deputy Commissioners-cum-Chairman of NCLPs, Planning Commission, Yojana Bhavan, Deputy Secretary (PF.II), Department of Expenditure, Ministry of Finance, North Block, New Delhi, PS to LEM, PSD to Secretary (L&E), JS&FA, Ministry of Labour & Employment, All Divisions of Ministry of Labour & Employment, and NIC, MOLE with request to place the order on the website under Child Labour Division of the Ministry for information.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the working group was to provide recommendations regarding the Working Group's recommendations on the scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Consideration of projects for environmental clearance based on Comprehensive Environmental Pollution Index (CEPI) - Lifting of Moratorium in respect of industrial clusters / areas of (i) Singrauli (Madhya Pradesh Part and Uttar Pradesh Part), (ii) Vapi (Gujarat), and (iii) Jharsuguda (Orissa) - Regarding.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the industrial clusters/areas mentioned in the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) Singrauli (Madhya Pradesh Part and Uttar Pradesh Part), (ii) Vapi (Gujarat), and (iii) Jharsuguda (Orissa).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the Ministry of Environment & Forests' previous memorandum regarding these industrial clusters/areas?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry had imposed a moratorium up to 31.8.2010 on consideration of projects for environmental clearance to be located in critically polluted areas/industrial clusters identified by Central Pollution Control Board.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the action plans prepared by the respective SPCBs/PCCs for improving the environmental quality in these industrial clusters?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The action plans so prepared would be finalized by CPCB.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the moratorium extended up to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The moratorium was extended up to 31st October, 2010.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the basis for extending the moratorium?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Based on the finalization of action plans and their initiation of implementation in respect of the five industrial clusters.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which five industrial clusters were confirmed by CPCB to have the moratorium lifted in respect of them?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) Tarapur (Maharashtra), (ii) Pattencheru-Bollaram (Andhra Pradesh), (iii) Coimbatore (Tamil Nadu), (iv) Vapi (Gujarat) and (v) Mandi-Gobindgarh (Punjab).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the moratorium further extended up to for the remaining 38 industrial clusters?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The moratorium was further extended up to 31st March, 2011 vide office memorandum of even no. dated 26.10.2010.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the basis for the subsequent report by the respective State Pollution Control Boards/Union Territory Pollution Control Committees?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Taking into account the recommendation of Central Pollution Control Board, moratorium was lifted in additional critically polluted industrial clusters.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which industrial clusters were mentioned as having the moratorium lifted in addition to the previous 5 clusters?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) Agra (Uttar Pradesh), (ii) Aurangabad (Maharashtra), (iii) Bhavnagar (Gujarat), (iv) Cuddalore (Tamil Nadu), (v) Dombivalli (Maharashtra), and (vi) Ludhiana (Punjab).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which other industrial clusters/areas had the moratorium extended up to 30
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) Navi Mumbai (Maharashtra) and (viii) Varanasi-Mirzapur (Uttar Pradesh).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Engineering Circular No. 70\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number?
question_answer_pairs.answer: NO:ENG/OPP.33(1)/2006-Annex II\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the document dated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 30th January, 2006\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Revisions to MARPOL 73/78 Annex II and Amendments to the IBC Code\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What were the revisions to MARPOL Annex II and the IBC Code adopted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revisions were adopted at the 52nd session of the IMO's Marine Environment Protection Committee in October 2004 and by the Maritime Safety Committee in December 2004.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the revised requirements come into force and take effect?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised requirements will accordingly come into force and take effect from 1 January 2007.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the salient points of the revised MARPOL Annex II and Amendments to the IBC Code?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The noxious liquid substances (NLS) are currently divided into five categories, namely A, B, C, D and an Appendix III. The IBC Code does not apply to products listed in Appendix III.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How has the categorization of substances been re-arranged under the revised Annex II?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Under the revised Annex II, the categorization of substances has been re-arranged and there will be 4 categories.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will Category X contain?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Category X will contain products deemed to present a major hazard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will Category Y contain?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Category Y will be for products deemed to present a hazard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will Category Z contain?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Category Z will contain products deemed to present a minor hazard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the fourth category \"OS\" or \"Other Substances\" hold?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The fourth category, \"OS\" or \"Other Substances\", holds only 8 harmless products: Apple juice, Clay slurry, Coal slurry, Dextrose solution, Glucose solution, Kaoline slurry, Molasses, Water and will replace the current Appendix III substances.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How have the Vegetable Oils and Animal Fats products been categorized?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These Vegetable oils and Animal Fats products have been assigned pollution category Y and Ship Type 2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for Type 2 vessels provided in the revised Annex?
question_answer_pairs.answer: However, the text of the revised Annex amended to allow named unmodified vegetable oils to be carried in Type 3 vessels provided they have double side and double bottoms meeting the requirements of Annex I (i.e. B/15 or 2meters, whichever is the lesser).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the Discharging and Stripping Requirements mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Consequent to the revision and amendments, all existing Certificates of Fitness as well as all NLS Certificates issued under the present requirements will become invalid from 1 January 2007.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for ships carrying a previous liquid substance in bulk from 1 January 2007?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If any ship intends to carry a previous liquid substance in bulk from 1 January 2007, it shall comply with the following requirements.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first requirement for ships carrying a previous liquid substance in bulk from 1 January 2007?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Shall need to hold an IBC Code CoF or NLS Certificate issued under the revised requirements.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many categories of noxious liquid substances are mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The noxious liquid substances (NLS) are currently divided into five categories, namely A, B, C, D and an Appendix III.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of Appendix III in the IBC Code?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The IBC Code does not apply to products listed in Appendix III.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many categories of noxious liquid substances will there be under the revised Annex II?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Under the revised Annex II, the categorization of substances has been re-arranged and there will be 4 categories.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the fourth category \"OS\" or \"Other Substances\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The fourth category, \"OS\" or \"Other Substances\", holds only 8 harmless products and will replace the current Appendix III substances.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How have the Vegetable Oils and Animal Fats products been categorized under the revised Annex?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These Vegetable oils and Animal Fats products have been assigned pollution category Y and Ship Type 2.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for Type 3 vessels carrying unmodified vegetable oils under the revised Annex?
question_answer_pairs.answer: However, the text of the revised Annex amended to allow named unmodified vegetable oils to be carried in Type 3 vessels provided they have double side and double bottoms meeting the requirements of Annex I.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the existing Certificates of Fitness and NLS Certificates become invalid?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Consequent to the revision and amendments, all existing Certificates of Fitness as well as all NLS Certificates issued under the present requirements will become invalid from 1 January 2007.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for ships intending to carry a previous liquid substance in bulk from 1 January 2007?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If any ship intends to carry a previous liquid substance in bulk from 1 January 2007, it shall comply with the following requirements.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first requirement for ships carrying a previous liquid substance in bulk from 1 January 2007?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Shall need to hold an IBC Code CoF or NLS Certificate issued under the revised requirements.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many categories of noxious liquid substances were there initially?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The noxious liquid substances (NLS) are currently divided into five categories, namely A, B, C, D and an Appendix III.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many categories of noxious liquid substances will there be under the revised Annex II?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Under the revised Annex II, the categorization of substances has been re-arranged and there will be 4 categories.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the fourth category \"OS\" or \"Other Substances\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The fourth category, \"OS\" or \"Other Substances\", holds only 8 harmless products and will replace the current Appendix III substances.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the organization that issued this invitation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The All India Council for Technical Education, New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this invitation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To invite proposals from all Educational Content Developers and Faculty Members of all Technical Higher Educational Institutions for the development of Self-Paced/Credit Courses for the SWAYAM Platform.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the SWAYAM platform?
question_answer_pairs.answer: SWAYAM is an emerging technology platform for online education, including Artificial Intelligence, Nano Technology, Blockchain, Quantum Computing, Mixed Reality, Data Analytics, and Indian Knowledge System.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for submitting proposals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The last date of receipt of proposals is 15th May, 2022.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can interested parties find more details about this invitation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They can visit the website www.aicte-india.org for more details.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the intended audience for this invitation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All Educational Content Developers and Faculty Members of all Technical Higher Educational Institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What types of courses are being sought for the SWAYAM platform?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Self-Paced or Credit Courses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum word count for the proposed course video and curriculum description?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Not more than 3000 words.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will review the proposals and decide which ones to accept or reject?
question_answer_pairs.answer: AICTE reserves the right to accept or reject the proposals for creation of new online courses for SWAYAM.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the email address for submitting proposals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: aicteswaym1@aicte-india.org.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the file number of this invitation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: F.No. 40-35/AICTE/SWAYAM/EOI/2017 (Part File).\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The SWAYAM Cell.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What types of emerging technologies are associated with the SWAYAM platform?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Artificial Intelligence, Nano Technology, Blockchain, Quantum Computing, Mixed Reality, and Data Analytics.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What other areas related to the Indian Knowledge System are associated with the SWAYAM platform?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Innovation, sustainable development, etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the format for submitting proposals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Along with a Three Minute Introductory Video.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Three Minute Introductory Video?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To describe the wise contents in not more than 3000 words of the proposed MOOC.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of MOOC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Massive Open Online Courses.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Member Secretary.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: For the development of Self-Paced or Credit Courses.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: For the development of Self-Paced/Credit Courses for the SWAYAM Platform.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of qualifications are the vocational qualifications mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Work-related qualifications.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of introducing the \"Fitness & Gym Operation\" vocational course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To allow students to develop employability skills and create career opportunities in the field of sports.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can the content of the proposed course be downloaded from?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board's website www.cbse.nic.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the schools applying for this course be required to begin the course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: From the session 2012-13.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the schools have for the students opting for this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A permanent Post Graduate Teacher in Physical Education on roll.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The school premises should have a Gym as a minimum infrastructure.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: 15 days duration.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: In May-June 2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the second program of the Physical Education Teacher training be held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In May-June 2013.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: At the venue to be informed by the Board.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How long will the students have to undergo in-house Internship Training?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 15 days.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the students' Internship Training be held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: During the summer vacation falling in between class XI & XII.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many schools will this course be initially introduced in?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 50 selected schools in class XI.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: From which academic session will this course be introduced?
How will the schools be selected for this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Based on the feedback received from these pilot schools.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the Board be discussing with various organizations?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The issue of Joint Certification of the course.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: A vocational course.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: For which class(es) is this course being introduced?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Class XI (Annexure-A) and class XII (Annexure-B).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the content of the proposed course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 06 units in theory section and the practical element focusing on working in a Gym.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the Board publish the text book for this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Soon.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: 15 days.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: May-June 2012 and May-June 2013.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: A Gym.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The students opting for the subject.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum was issued by the Ministry of Labour and Employment, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the office memorandum is \"Revised Integrated Housing Scheme - 2016\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is dated 21st March, 2016.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the undersigned in the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The undersigned is Deepak Datt Barnawal, Under Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to forward a copy of the Revised Integrated Housing Scheme - 2016 (RIHS-2016) to the workers engaged in Beedi/Iron Ore Mines, Manganese Ore Mines & Chrome Ore Mines (MCOC)/Limestone Ore Mines, Dolomite Ore Mines (LSDM)/Mica Mines and Cine Industries, registered with the Labour Welfare Organisation (LWO).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which workers are covered under the Revised Integrated Housing Scheme - 2016?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The workers engaged in Beedi/Iron Ore Mines, Manganese Ore Mines & Chrome Ore Mines (MCOC)/Limestone Ore Mines, Dolomite Ore Mines (LSDM)/Mica Mines and Cine Industries, registered with the Labour Welfare Organisation (LWO) are covered under the Revised Integrated Housing Scheme - 2016.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is addressed to all Welfare & Cess Commissioners (as per the list attached).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of forwarding the copy of the Revised Integrated Housing Scheme - 2016?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to apply the RIHS-2016 to the workers engaged in the specified industries.\n

Branch), M/o Finance, Department of Expenditure, North Block, New Delhi, Budget & Accounts Section/Pay & Accounts Office (MS), Finance I-II Branch, Ministry of Labour & Employment, and All Members of CAC of all CSS Funds.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to sanction the transfer of the HAG/IRSE post of PC/STE/CORE (PC:10E12P001) to IRISET and the SAG/IRSE post of Sr. Professor/Tele-II/IRISET (PC:10ET4P005) to CORE on swap basis.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first action mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: IRISET may be advised to stop operation of the SAG/IRSE post at Asst. Professor Tele-II which has been utilized in chain upgradation for the SAG/IRSE post of IRISET (PC:10ET4P005).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second action mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The operation of the HAG/SAG/IRSE posts at transferred locations will be effective from the date of release of the posts by the concerned Railways or from the date of actual operation of posts at transferred locations, whichever is later.\n
