question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to Principal Chief Commissioners/Principal Directors General, Chief Commissioners/Directors General, and Principal Commissioners/Commissioners of GST and Central Tax (All).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Clarification regarding GST tax rate for Sprinkler and Drip Irrigation System including laterals-reg.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the entry number mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The entry number mentioned is 195B.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the chapter heading/sub-heading/tariff item mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The chapter heading/sub-heading/tariff item is 8424.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the description of goods mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The description of goods is Sprinklers; drip irrigation system including laterals.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the CGST rate mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The CGST rate mentioned is 6%.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for the doubts that have arisen regarding the scope of this entry?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Doubts have arisen as to whether \"laterals of sprinklers\" and \"sprinklers irrigation system\" are covered by this entry.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the initial decision regarding the goods falling under HS 8424?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Initially, with effect from 1.7.2017, all goods falling under HS 8424, namely, Mechanical appliances (whether or not hand-operated) for projecting, dispersing or spraying liquids or powders; spray guns and similar appliances; steam or sand blasting machines and similar jet projecting machines (other than fire extinguishers, whether or not charged), were placed under 18% slab.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the recommendation of the GST Council regarding the item \"Nozzles for drip irrigation equipment or nozzles for sprinkler\"?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GST Council recommended 12% GST rate on \"Nozzles for drip irrigation equipment or nozzles for sprinkler\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the issue that was revisited regarding the GST rate on micro irrigation system, including laterals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Upon revisiting the issue of GST rate on micro irrigation system, including laterals, the GST Council recommended 12% GST rate on micro irrigation system, including laterals.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the webinar being conducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the webinar is \"Education Leadership\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is organizing the webinar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The webinar is being organized by the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) in collaboration with the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the objective of the webinar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The objective of the webinar is to help the participants reflect on leadership competencies in the context of leading academic institutions and keep acquainted with the recent know-how in the context of leadership.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the topics that will be covered in the webinar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The webinar will emphasize the emerging context of Education, present-day challenges for Education Leaders, and Leadership Skills for leaders in academic institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the participants be able to do at the end of the webinar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The participants will be able to know about some of the leadership competencies required in the context of academic institutions, reflect on their own leadership competencies as educational leaders, identify areas for implementing in their own context to strengthen their leadership competencies, and understand new approaches to deal with the contemporary approach to leadership.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the webinar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The webinar will be approximately 90 minutes long.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What will the webinar include?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The webinar will include teaching by the faculty and an interactive session where delegates would be engaged by asking questions and the faculty interact with them as per the requirements of the webinar.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date and time of the webinar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The webinar is scheduled for 30th January 2023 from 09:30 AM to 11:00 AM.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Webex link for joining the webinar is https://cbse.webex.com/cbse/j.php?MTID=ma81b90a2720b7a7e9b5a0e96c35908.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The YouTube link for joining the webinar is https://www.youtube.com/live/aXGK-r2ao?feature=share.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Is there any participation fee for attending the webinar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, there is no participation fee for attending this event.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Due to limited availability, participants are requested to log in timely to the webex platform or watch using the YouTube link.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated 29th March, 2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Withholding/Retaining of original certificates of faculty/Non-Teaching Staff Members/Students by the employer Institutions.\"\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is F.No. 1-101/DPG/AICTE/Regulation/2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main issue addressed in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main issue is that AICTE has been receiving complaints about institutions withholding or retaining the original education qualification certificates of faculty, non-teaching staff, and students.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What action does the document state will be taken against institutions that violate the guidelines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that any violation in this regard shall attract strict punitive action, including \"withdrawal of Approval\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the institutions directed to do according to the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The institutions are directed to comply with the guidelines of AICTE and not indulge in such illegal and unethical restrictive practices.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the members of faculty/non-teaching staff advised to give at least one month's notice while leaving the job?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document advises members of faculty/non-teaching staff of technical institutions to give at least one month's notice while leaving the job in the mid-session.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clear violation of AICTE norms mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that it has come to the notice of AICTE that some institutions are withholding the original certificates of students cancelling their admission at any point of time and demanding fee for subsequent years, which is a clear violation of AICTE norms.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What action does the document state will be taken against institutions that violate the norms?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that any such violation shall attract strict punitive action.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the copies of the document sent to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The copies of the document are sent to the Advisor (Approval), All Regional Officers of the Council, and the Director (e-governance), AICTE.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of issuing this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to address the complaints received by AICTE regarding institutions withholding or retaining the original education qualification certificates of faculty, non-teaching staff, and students.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main directive given to the AICTE-approved technical institutions in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main directive is that all the AICTE-approved Technical Institutions are directed to comply with the guidelines of AICTE and not indulge in such illegal and unethical restrictive practices.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason stated for issuing this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason stated is that AICTE has been receiving a number of complaints against the Institutions for withholding/retaining the original education qualification certificates of faculty/non-teaching staff members resigning/leaving from employment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the notice period mentioned for faculty/non-teaching staff members leaving their job?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document advises members of faculty/non-teaching staff to give at least one month's notice while leaving the job in the mid-session.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clear violation of AICTE norms mentioned regarding students' admission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that some Institutions are withholding the original certificates of students cancelling their admission at any point of time and demanding fee for subsequent years, which is a clear violation of AICTE norms.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the strict punitive action that can be taken against institutions violating the guidelines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that any violation in this regard shall attract strict punitive action, including \"withdrawal of Approval\".\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by Prof. A.P.Mittal, the Member Secretary of the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to ensure that the AICTE-approved Technical Institutions comply with the guidelines of AICTE and do not indulge in any illegal and unethical restrictive practices.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Office Memorandum was issued by the Ministry of Environment & Forests, Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Office Memorandum is dated November 19, 2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the Office Memorandum is \"Guidelines for granting Environment Clearance for expansion of Coal Mining Projects involving one time Capacity Expansion of up to 25% of the existing operation\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this Office Memorandum is to provide guidelines for granting Environment Clearance for expansion of Coal Mining Projects involving one time capacity expansion of up to 25% of the existing operation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference to the previous OM mentioned in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference is to the OM of even number dated 13th April, 2010, which contained the guidelines for granting Environment Clearance (EC) for expansion of coal mining sector projects.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key change mentioned in this OM compared to the previous one?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The key change is that the guidelines issued in this OM will be applicable in supersession of the guidelines of 13th April, 2010 OM.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the one-time capacity expansion allowed under this OM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The one-time capacity expansion allowed under this OM is up to 25% of the existing mining operation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the categories of coal mining projects that are covered under this OM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The OM covers coal mining projects that have obtained EC under the EIA Notification, 2006 and are seeking one time capacity expansion of up to 25% in the existing mining operation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the expansion project as per this OM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The expansion project shall include a certified report of the Regional Office of the MoEF on the compliance of EC conditions stipulated for the existing project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the public hearing for the expansion project?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There is no additional public hearing required for the expansion project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the change in the mining method allowed under this OM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There is no change in the mining method (underground to opencast) allowed under this OM.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the validity period of the EC granted under this OM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The validity of the EC granted under this OM will be the same as the validity of the EC of the existing project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the court cases, if any, pending against the project?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Details of the court cases, if any, pending in any Court of Law against the project as well as directions passed by any Court relating to the project shall be furnished to the regulatory authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the notices, if any, issued to the project under Section 5 of the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Details of notices, if any, issued to the project under Section 5 of the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 will be deliberated upon the same and the gist of the discussion will be reflected in the minutes of the EAC meeting.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the project proponent to submit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The project proponent shall submit a certified report of the Regional Office of the MoEF on the compliance of EC conditions stipulated for the existing project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the public hearing for the expansion project?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There is no additional public hearing required for the expansion project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the mining method change in the expansion project?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There is no change in the mining method (underground to opencast) allowed under this OM.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The validity of the EC granted under this OM will be the same as the validity of the EC of the existing project.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the three main requirements mentioned for the expansion projects?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The three main requirements are: (i) Such an expansion project should have obtained prior EC and have undergone Public Hearing, (ii) The proposal is for one time capacity expansion of up to 25% on the existing coal mining operation, and (iii) There is no additional mine lease area involved.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide clarification regarding the removal of restriction of refund of accumulated ITC on fabrics\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for issuing this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Certain doubts have been raised regarding the applicability and intent of notification No. 20/2018-Central Tax (Rate) dated 26th July, 2018 and notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax (Rate) dated 28.06.2017\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the notification No. 20/2018-Central Tax (Rate) seeking to do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It seeks to amend notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax (Rate) relating to the provision for lapsing of input tax credit accumulated on account of inverted duty structure on fabrics for the period upto the 31st July, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Under what section of the law was the notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax (Rate) issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It was issued in exercise of powers vested under section 54 of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax (Rate) notify?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It notifies the items on which refund of accumulated input tax credit on account of inverted duty structure is not allowed, which includes fabrics.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many categories of fabrics are covered in the notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax (Rate)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A total of 10 categories of fabrics are covered in the notification.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide clarification regarding the removal of restriction of refund of accumulated ITC on fabrics.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the intent of the notification No. 20/2018-Central Tax (Rate)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The intent is to amend the earlier notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax (Rate) dated 28.06.2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the period up to which the refund of accumulated input tax credit on fabrics is allowed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Up to the 31st July, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for issuing this clarification circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Certain doubts have been raised regarding the applicability and intent of the notifications mentioned.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: It was issued under section 54 of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the notification No. 5/2017-Central Tax (Rate)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To notify the items on which refund of accumulated input tax credit on account of inverted duty structure is not allowed, which includes fabrics.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the notification No. 20/2018-Central Tax (Rate)?

question_answer_pairs.answer: Inviting application for post of Deputy Director (Technology) on deputation (Foreign Service term basis) in Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) Data Centre at Manesar (Gurugram).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the post mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Deputy Director (Tech.).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many vacancies are there for the post of Deputy Director (Tech)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: One.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility/qualification criteria for the post of Deputy Director (Tech)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers from the Central Government holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre/department, OR with three years of regular service in the Pay Matrix level 11.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the alternative eligibility/qualification criteria for the post of Deputy Director (Tech)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers with five years of regular service in the Pay Matrix level 10 OR with six years of regular service in the Pay Matrix level 9 from State/UT Government/Public Sector Undertaking/Autonomous Organization holding regular post in corresponding grades with requisite experience.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum educational qualification required for the post of Deputy Director (Tech)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Four year degree in Engineering or Technology or Master's Degree in Computer Applications from an Institute recognized by Govt. agencies.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the desirable qualifications for the post of Deputy Director (Tech)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Handling ICTE-governance Projects in Central Government/State Govt./PSU/Autonomous body etc., Handling IT/Telecom/Networking/Data Centre operations related works, Dealing IT procurements/IT inventory management related work, Dealing with planning, execution, O&M nature of works in Technical projects in the field of IT, Software, Telecom etc., Handling the work of software development, DATABASE administration, Network/Network Security Administration, Linux administration etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit for the post of Deputy Director (Tech)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The candidate should be below 56 years of age as on the closing date of the application.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the period of deputation for the post of Deputy Director (Tech)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The period of deputation shall be of five years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the general terms and conditions of services at UIDAI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The general terms and conditions of services at UIDAI will be governed as per Unique Identification Authority of India (Appointment of Officers and employees) Regulations, 2020 and guidelines of the Central Government.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be given preference for the post of Deputy Director (Tech)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers already holding analogous posts in the parent cadre/department may be given preference.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: 10th July, 2023.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the definition of a 'Class-I local supplier' as per this order?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number and date of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number is 36/10/2018-GST and the date is 13th March, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government ministry issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular was issued by the Government of India, Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, Central Board of Excise and Customs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Processing of refund applications for UIN entities\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the GST Council decide to give centralized registration to entities with Unique Identity Number (UIN)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GST Council decided this in its 23rd meeting held at Guwahati on 10th November 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to clarify some issues and ensure uniformity of implementation across field formations regarding the centralized registration of UIN entities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Under which section of the CGST Act does this circular derive its powers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular derives its powers under section 168 (1) of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the special status given to entities having a UIN under the CGST Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Entities having a UIN are given a special status under the CGST Act as they are not covered under the definition of registered person.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of granting UINs to entities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: UINs are granted to enable them to claim refund of GST paid on inward supply of goods or services or both received by them.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for such entities to claim GST refund?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If any such entity is making supply of goods or services or both, then such entity will need to apply for GSTIN as per the provisions contained in the CGST Act.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where has the process for applying for UIN been outlined?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The process for applying for UIN has been outlined under Rule 17 of the CGST Rules, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to the Principal Chief Commissioners/Chief Commissioners/Commissioners of Central Tax (All), The Principal Director Generals / Director Generals (All), The Principal Chief Controller of Accounts, CBEC, and Madam/Sir.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of centralizing the registration of UIN entities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to ensure uniformity of implementation across field formations in respect of such entities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the centralized registration of UIN entities be implemented?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government will be responsible for all administrative compliances in respect of such entities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the definition of a registered person under the CGST Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As per the circular, entities having UINs are not covered under the definition of registered person.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process outlined in the circular for entities having UINs to claim GST refund?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The process has been outlined under Rule 17 of the CGST Rules, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of applying for a GSTIN by entities having UINs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Entities having UINs and making supply of goods or services or both will need to apply for a GSTIN.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the rationale behind granting UINs to certain entities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: UINs are granted to enable such entities to claim refund of GST paid on inward supply of goods or services or both received by them.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the circular ensure uniformity of implementation across field formations?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular clarifies the issues and ensures uniformity of implementation across field formations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the legal basis for the powers exercised in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular derives its powers under section 168 (1) of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the key stakeholders mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The key stakeholders mentioned are the Principal Chief Commissioners/Chief Commissioners/Commissioners of Central Tax (All), The Principal Director Generals / Director Generals (All), The Principal Chief Controller of Accounts, CBEC, and Madam/Sir.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the 23rd meeting of the GST Council mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It was in this meeting that the GST Council decided to give centralized registration to entities with Unique Identity Number (UIN).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the circular ensure administrative compliance for UIN entities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government will be responsible for all administrative compliances in respect of such entities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the rationale behind the requirement for UIN entities to apply for GSTIN?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This requirement is to enable such entities to claim refund of GST paid on inward supply of goods or services or both.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can the detailed process for applying for UIN be found?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The detailed process for applying for UIN has been outlined under Rule 17 of the CGST Rules, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the objective of the circular in clarifying the issues related to UIN entities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The objective is to ensure uniformity of implementation across field formations in respect of such entities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the authorities responsible for the administrative compliances of UIN entities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As per the circular, the Central Government will be responsible for all administrative compliances in respect of such entities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the legal provision that empowers the Central Government to be responsible for the administrative compliances of UIN entities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular derives its powers under section 168 (1) of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the circular ensure that UIN entities can effectively claim GST refunds?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular clarifies the process for UIN entities to apply for GSTIN, which is a requirement for them to claim GST refunds.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the GST Council's decision to grant centralized registration to UIN entities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This decision ensures uniformity of implementation across field formations in respect of such entities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the government organization that issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government of Goa Directorate of Education.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is dated 4/1/2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is about celebrating World Elders' Day on October 1st in educational institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who had requested the Directorate of Education to issue instructions to celebrate World Elders' Day?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The All Goa Senior Citizens' Federation had requested the Directorate to issue these instructions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What role do elders play in molding children, according to the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Elders play an important role in molding the children, as our children should respect the elders.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the directive given to heads of all institutions recognized by this Directorate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They are enjoined to celebrate October 1st as \"World Elders' Day\" with suitable programs in their institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Director of Education that has signed this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Nila Mohanan, IAS is the Director of Education.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the email address provided in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The email address provided is dir.edu.goa@nic.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the contact numbers provided in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The contact numbers provided are Tel: 0832-2416023, 2416033 and Fax: 0832-2416136.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of celebrating World Elders' Day, according to the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To promote harmony in society and ensure that young students respect elders.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which schools are the recipients of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to the Heads of all the Government/Government Aided & Unaided Primary, Middle, Secondary, Higher Secondary & Special Schools in the State of Goa.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who else has been copied on this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Director of Social Welfare, Panaji-Goa, The President of the All Goa Senior Citizens' Federation, and the Dy. Director of Education, North/South/Central Educational Zone, Mapusa/Margao/Panaji-Goa.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of copying the Dy
question_answer_pairs.answer: To ensure the instructions reach all educational institutions under the jurisdiction of the Directorate.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who else has been copied on this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The A.D.E.I.s of all the Talukas and the Nodal Officer, IT for uploading on the website of this Directorate.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of copying the A
question_answer_pairs.answer: To ensure the instructions reach all educational institutions and are uploaded on the Directorate's website.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of World Elders' Day, according to the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is celebrated on October 1st every year throughout the State.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of elders in molding children, according to the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Elders play an important role in molding the children, as our children should respect the elders.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the directive given to educational institutions regarding World Elders' Day celebrations?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They are enjoined to celebrate October 1st as \"World Elders' Day\" with suitable programs in their institutions.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of celebrating World Elders' Day in educational institutions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To promote harmony in society and ensure that young students respect elders.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who had requested the Directorate of Education to issue these instructions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The All Goa Senior Citizens' Federation had requested the Directorate to issue these instructions.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number mentioned in the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: DE/Acad/Bud-Sp-Sel-Sc/2014/4/3\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who issued this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government of Goa, Directorate of Education, Porvorim-Goa\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this order?
What is the purpose of this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order is regarding the Selection Scale as announced by the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the recommendation mentioned in this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The recommendation of National Commission on Teachers chaired by Prof. D. P. Chattopaadhyaya has been implemented by the Government of Goa.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this recommendation implemented?
question_answer_pairs.answer: With effect from 1/1/1986 onwards.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition laid down for the eligibility of Selection Scale?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Selection Scale will be restricted to 20% of the number of posts in Senior Scale of the respective cadre.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What did the Hon'ble Chief Minister announce in his Budget Speech?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To do away with the above stated condition of 20% quota system in awarding Selection Scale to teachers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the decision taken by the State Government after examining the above matter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To do away with the above stated condition of 20% quota system prospectively with effect from 01/04/2014 for the grant of Selection Scale to the eligible teachers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for the teachers to be granted Selection Scale?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eligible teacher who possesses the educational qualification and fulfills all other conditions as laid down in the No: F.5-180-UT-I dated 12th August, 1987 and deprived of Selection Scale as per the 20% quota system.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has concurred with this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Finance (Rev & Control) Department under U.No:14969/34, dated 18/6/2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed this order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Director of Education & Ex-Officio to the Government of Goa.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is this order addressed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Heads of Govt./Govt. Aided Primary/Secondary/Higher Secondary & Special Schools in the State of Goa.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Filling up the post of Director General in Archaeological Survey of India, Head Quarter, New Delhi under Ministry of Culture on deputation or on contract basis.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay matrix and grade for the post of Director General?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Level-15 of Pay matrix [Pre-revised-Pay Band Higher Administrative Grade (HAG)] Rs.67000/- (annual increment @ 3%) - 79000/-.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mode of selection for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The mode of selection is through high-level Search-cum-Selection Committee under the chairmanship of Cabinet Secretary.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for the post on deputation basis?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers under the Central Govt. or the State Government or Union territories or public sector undertakings or Universities or recognized research institution or semi-Government or statutory or Autonomous Organizations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two eligibility criteria for the post on deputation basis?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) Holding analogous post on regular basis; or (ii) With three years' service in the grade rendered after appointment thereto on a regular basis in the post in the scale of pay of Rs.37400-67000 with grade pay Rs.10000 or equivalent in the parent cadre or department.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the educational qualifications and experience required for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Possessing the following educational qualifications and experience.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The incumbent will head the Archaeological Survey of India and will be overall in-charge of its functioning and will work with the Ministry of Culture for coordination and policy formulation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Promotion of Government servants during training or deputation in India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the undersigned of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: R.C. Puri, Under Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of the office memorandum?
What is the date of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 14th March, 1978.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the office memorandum, under what circumstances can a government servant be promoted while on training or deputation in India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If he is otherwise entitled to such promotion.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the condition for a government servant to be promoted while on training or deputation in India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The promotion should not involve a change in the duties and responsibilities of the post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the decision of the President regarding the promotion of government servants while on training or deputation in India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The President is pleased to decide that in such cases, there should be no objection to the promotion of the officers to the next higher grade.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision of Para 2 of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisions of Para 2 will also apply to cases of officers deputed abroad for training under FR 51.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will these orders take effect?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These orders will take effect from the date of issue.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the addressees of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All Ministries/Departments of the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the office memorandum in terms of providing guidance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide guidance on the procedure for promotion of government servants while they are on training or deputation in India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference to the relevant rule in the office memorandum?
What is the question that has been raised in this connection?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Whether a government servant who is undergoing training or deputation in India is entitled to the higher grade during the period of training or deputation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What additional benefit may the government servant be allowed to draw?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The government servant may also be allowed to draw such officiating pay in the next higher grade which he would have drawn from time to time had he been on duty other than under F.R.9(6)(b).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How do the provisions of this office memorandum apply to cases of officers deputed abroad for training?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisions of Para 2 will also apply to such cases.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: In so far as persons serving in the Indian Audit and Accounts Departments are concerned, what will happen?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These orders will be issued after consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor General of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the office memorandum regarding the promotion of government servants during training or deputation in India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To clarify the rules regarding the pay and promotion of government servants during such training or deputation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two main conditions that need to be fulfilled for promotion during training or deputation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (a) The officer has been approved for promotion to the next higher grade, and (b) All his seniors, except those regarded as unfit, have been promoted to that higher grade.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How do the provisions of this office memorandum apply to cases of officers deputed abroad for training?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisions of Para 2 will also apply to such cases.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will these orders take effect from?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These orders will take effect from the date of issue.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: R.C. Puri, Under Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 14th March, 1978.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number of this office memorandum?
Which department of the Government of India has issued this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Ministry of Finance (Department of Expenditure).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key rule referenced in this office memorandum?
What is the main decision taken by the President regarding the promotion of government servants during training or deputation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There should be no objection to the promotion of such officers to the next higher grade, provided certain conditions are met.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What additional benefit may the government servant be allowed to draw?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The government servant may also be allowed to draw the officiating pay in the next higher grade that he would have drawn had he been on duty other than under F.R.9(6)(b).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How are the Indian Audit and Accounts Departments consulted regarding these orders?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These orders are issued after consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor General of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the issuing authority for this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: R.C. Puri, Under Secretary to the Government of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main subject of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Promotion of government servants during training or deputation in India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two main conditions that need to be fulfilled for promotion of government servants during training or deputation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Approval for promotion to the next higher grade, and all the officer's seniors, except those regarded as unfit, have been promoted to that higher grade.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How do the provisions of this office memorandum apply to cases of officers deputed abroad for training?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisions of Para 2 will also apply to such cases.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the rule mentioned in the office memorandum that governs the pay of government servants during training or deputation?
What is the decision of the government on the question raised?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There should be no objection to the promotion of the officers to the next higher grade, if the conditions are fulfilled.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two conditions mentioned that need to be fulfilled for the promotion or higher grade pay to be granted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (a) The officer has been approved for promotion, and (b) All his seniors, except those regarded as unfit, have been promoted.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the provisions of Para 2 of this OM also apply?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisions will also apply to cases of officers deputed abroad for training under FR 54.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When will these orders take effect from?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These orders will take effect from the date of issue.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: In so far as persons serving in the Indian Audit and Accounts Departments are concerned, what will happen?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These orders will be issued after consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor General of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide guidance on the treatment of government servants who are promoted or granted higher grade pay while on training or deputation in India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the document is \"Payment of 1% Annual Fee reg-\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document communicates to all the approved training institutes that they should remit annual fee @ 1% of the total amount of fees collected from the candidates for imparting training on various courses at their institutes immediately at the end of every financial year (ending 31st March).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for the annual fee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The annual fee is required as per the Directorate vide Circular No. 3-TR(57)/98 dated 21.7.98.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence for defaulting institutes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The defaulting institutes should be imposed the penalty of 10% interest on the amount of 1% annual fee due from them, minimum to Rs.5,000/-.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for paying the annual fee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The annual fee for the period from 1.4.2000 to 31.3.2001 may please be remitted to this office before the due date.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The total number of candidates trained from 1.4.2000 to 31.3.2001 is Grand Total.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The total fee collected from 1.4.2000 to 31.3.2001 is Rs.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Regarding status report of Group D vacant posts due to non joining/un-willing/resigned which were advertised by Advt. No. 4/2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the letter addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All the Administrative Secretaries to Govt. of Haryana, All the Heads of Departments, All the Managing Directors/Chief Administrators of Boards/Corporations in Haryana, All the Divisional Commissioners in Haryana, All the Deputy Commissioners in Haryana.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the letter number mentioned in the document?
What is the date of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Dated: Chandigarh the 9th October, 2020.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To invite attention to letter No. 42/11/2018-2GS-I, dated 01.10.2020 on the subject noted above.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the content of the letter dated 01.10.2020?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It directed the concerned Heads of Departments/Boards/Corporations etc. to provide the category wise data of the Group D posts pertaining to Advt. No. 4/2018 which are lying vacant due to non joining/un-willing etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the deadline given in the previous letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Up to 12.10.2020 but the same has not been made available by most of the Departments/Boards/Corporations, as per the attached Annexure-A.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What action has the government taken?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Government has taken it seriously and decided to again direct all the Heads of Departments/Boards/Corporations etc. to send the data of category wise vacant posts of above said Group D posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How should the data be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Through email at generalservices001@gmail.com and secretary.hssc@hry.gov.in before 12.10.2020 positively so that the candidates of waiting list may be recommended by HSSC for appointment against these posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What issue has been noticed by the Department?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has also been noticed that some of the Departments/Boards/Corporations have not sent the actual data of vacant posts as a result of which the candidates recommended by HSSC are waiting for appointment since last more than two months.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What action will the Department take?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It would be very difficult for the Government/HSSC to adjust them because against the posts created after the advertisement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What decision has been taken by the government?
question_answer_pairs.answer: For quick adjustment of candidates from waiting list, it has also been decided by Government that a meeting will be held on 14.10.2020 at 2.00 P.M. in the Conference Room of HSSC Panchkula.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is requested to attend the meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: You are requested to depute your Nodal Officer to attend the meeting in the Conference Room of HSSC, Panchkula along with the latest factual vacancy position category wise duly filled in the prescribed proforma as per Annexure-B (attached).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Annexure-A mentioned in the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It contains the list of Departments/Boards/Corporations that have not provided the data of vacant posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Annexure-B mentioned in the letter?

file_name: img_fp_Ministry of Road Transport and Highways_Circular%20Yoga%202021.png

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is No.11012/02/2019-CG and the date is 17th June 2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Road Transport & Highways (MORTH) issued this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to celebrate the 7th International Day of Yoga (IDY) - 2021 by MORTH.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the International Day of Yoga (IDY) declared by the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The UNGA had taken a historic decision in 2014 to declare the 21st of June as the International Day of Yoga (IDY).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the objective of celebrating IDY according to the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The objective is to build an enduring public interest in yoga by highlighting its importance and contribution as a significant asset for improving public health and emotional wellness.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the celebration of IDY-2021 be conducted this year due to the pandemic situation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The celebration will be virtual/digital/online as the national level event of IDY-2021 is likely to be in the virtual/digital mode.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the theme message being promoted for the celebration of IDY-2021?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The theme message is #BeWithYogaBeAtHome.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What digital platforms are being extended for the IDY-2021 celebration?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Various digital platforms are being extended, including the \"IDY Handbook\" developed by the Ministry of Ayush.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What media activities has the Media Cell of this Ministry undertaken in connection with IDY-2021?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Media Cell has undertaken various social media activities like using the hashtags #BeAtHomeWithYoga, #IDY2021 to create a buzz.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of quiz competition is being organized as part of the IDY-2021 celebration?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A quiz competition is being organized where the participants will be asked to name a particular asana.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of selfie competition is being organized for IDY-2021?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A selfie competition on the occasion where the submitted pictures will be broadcast on the Ministry's various social media platforms.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of messages/creatives related to International Day of Yoga have been received/amplified by the AYUSH Ministry?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The messages/creatives received from the AYUSH Ministry are being reviewed/amplified.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Apart from the above activities, what other activities will also be organized by this Ministry in connection with IDY-2021?
question_answer_pairs.answer: An online essay competition on the topic \"Yoga for healthy Living\" will be organized with prize money.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the prize categories and amounts for the online essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The prize categories are 1st - Rs. 30,000/-, 2nd - Rs. 25,000/-, 3rd - Rs. 20,000/- and four consolation prizes of Rs. 10,000/- each.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the word limit for the essay submission in the online essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The word limit for the essay is between 400-500 words and it could be either in Hindi or English.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the last date for online submission of essays for the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The last date for online submission of essays is 21.06.2021 till 5:30PM.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who should the officers/officials be directed to participate in the Essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All officers/officials are requested to participate in the Essay competition.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of the abbreviation P
question_answer_pairs.answer: P.T.O. stands for \"Please Turn Over\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many hashtags are mentioned in the circular to create a buzz on social media for IDY-2021?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Two hashtags are mentioned - #BeAtHomeWithYoga and #IDY2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of quiz competition is being organized as part of the IDY-2021 celebration?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A quiz competition is being organized where the participants will be asked to name a particular asana.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the objective of organizing the quiz competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The objective is to create awareness about yoga among the participants.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the selfie competition on the occasion of IDY-2021 be broadcast?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The submitted pictures for the selfie competition will be broadcast on the Ministry's various social media platforms.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the messages/creatives related to International Day of Yoga that have been received by the AYUSH Ministry?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The messages/creatives received are being reviewed and amplified.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the last date for online submission of essays for the online essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The last date for online submission of essays is 21.06.2021 till 5:30PM.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the prize amounts for the online essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The prize amounts are 1st - Rs. 30,000/-, 2nd - Rs. 25,000/-, 3rd - Rs. 20,000/- and four consolation prizes of Rs. 10,000/- each.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: In what two languages can the essays be submitted for the online essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The essays can be submitted either in Hindi or English.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who should be directed to participate in the online essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All officers/officials are requested to participate in the Essay competition.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the word limit for the essays to be submitted in the online essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The word limit for the essays is between 400-500 words.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the theme of the online essay competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The theme is \"Yoga for healthy Living\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is ONLINE Level 'B' Training programme at ISTM for Assistant Section Officers (ASO) of CSS to be eligible for promotion to Section Officer Grade from the Select List (Batch).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the office memorandum dated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum was dated the 22nd October, 2020.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the undersigned in the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The undersigned is not identified in the image.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to inform officers whose names are given in Annexure I that they have been nominated to participate in the mandatory Level 'B' Training Programme being conducted by ISTM from 9.11.2020 to 11.12.2020.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the training be conducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training will be conducted online by ISTM and the participants are not required to visit ISTM in person for the same.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the training be accessible to the participants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training will be accessible through mobile or laptop/desktop as per the convenience of the participants.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mandatory nature of the training mentioned in the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training of the officers and its successful completion is mandatory as per DoPT Notification G.S.R 485(E) dated 12th July 2013.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the performance of the officers in the training be evaluated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The performance of the officers in the training will be evaluated and the reports added in their APARs, which will be considered for their further career progression.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the consequences for officers who do not attend the training successfully?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officers who do not attend the training successfully will be debarred and denied of promotion as envisaged in the OM.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the phases of the Mandatory Cadre Training Programme mentioned in the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All phases of the Mandatory Cadre Training Programme shall be attended by all officers as and when they are eligible.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum number of chances given to complete each level of the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers are given a maximum of two chances to complete each level of the Training Programme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence of not attending the training within the first two chances?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Postponement of participation from the first chance to second chance is allowed only with prior approval. However, such postponement does not entitle the officer for respective promotion/posting/increments in relaxation of the Rules.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence of not attending the training even in the second chance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If an officer does not successfully complete the respective cadre training programme even in the Second chance, he/she would be debarred as defined in above OM.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the additional benefits allowed for officers who successfully complete the First chance of the training?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Postponement of participation from the First chance to Second chance would be allowed by DoPT only under defined as extraordinary circumstances.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the study leave benefits available to officers undergoing the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers undergoing study programme (domestic/foreign) by availing Study Leave or partial funding or nominated by Competent Authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the medical benefits available to officers undergoing the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Medical reimbursement to the officer, his/her spouse, children of the officer and parents-in-law of the officer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis for maternity leave granted to female officers during the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Maternity leave on the basis of medical certificate issued by AMA.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the child care leave benefit available to officers with children during the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Child care leave as per rules applicable to the officers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the election duty benefit available to officers during the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers on Election duty.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number and date of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number is 103/22/2019-GST and the date is 28th June, 2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government department issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Department of Revenue, Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, GST Policy Wing issued this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Clarification regarding determination of place of supply in certain cases - reg.\"\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two types of services mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) Services provided by Ports - place of supply in respect of various cargo handling services provided by ports to clients, and (ii) Services rendered on goods temporarily imported into India - place of supply in case of services rendered on unpolished diamonds received from abroad, which are exported after cutting, polishing etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What Act is referred to in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Integrated Goods & Services Tax Act, 2017 (hereinafter referred to as \"the IGST Act\") is referred to in this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What section of the Central Goods & Services Tax Act, 2017 is mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Sub-section (1) of section 168 of the Central Goods & Services Tax Act, 2017 is mentioned.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Principal Chief Commissioners / Chief Commissioners / Principal Commissioners / Commissioners of Central Tax (All) and The Principal Director Generals / Director Generals (All) are the recipients of this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide clarification regarding determination of place of supply in certain cases.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two types of services mentioned in the first point of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Services provided by Ports to clients and services rendered on goods temporarily imported into India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the place of supply for services provided by Ports to clients?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The place of supply is in respect of various cargo handling services provided by ports to clients.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the place of supply for services rendered on goods temporarily imported into India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The place of supply is in case of services rendered on unpolished diamonds received from abroad, which are exported after cutting, polishing etc.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What Act is referred to as \"the IGST Act\" in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Integrated Goods & Services Tax Act, 2017 is referred to as \"the IGST Act\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What Act is referred to as \"the CGST Act\" in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Goods & Services Tax Act, 2017 is referred to as \"the CGST Act\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Under which section of the CGST Act does the Board exercise its powers as mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board exercises its powers under sub-section (1) of section 168 of the CGST Act.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the Principal Chief Commissioners / Chief Commissioners / Principal Commissioners / Commissioners mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They are the recipients of this circular from the Department of Revenue.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the Principal Director Generals / Director Generals mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They are the other recipients of this circular from the Department of Revenue.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of examining the provisions relating to determination of place of supply as contained in the IGST Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to ensure uniformity in the implementation of the provisions of the law.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The office is located at Transport Bhawan, 1, Parliament Street, New Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the guidelines mentioned, what is the maximum number of channels of submission that staff in the ministry can use?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The guidelines state that the channels of submission should not be more than four, for all categories/levels of officers.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the four categories/levels of officers mentioned in the guidelines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The four categories/levels are: Category/level I, Category/level II, Category/level III, and Category/level IV.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the designated officer for Category/level I submissions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The designated officer for Category/level I submissions is the Secretary.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the designated officer for Category/level II submissions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The designated officer for Category/level II submissions is the Additional Secretary/Joint Secretary or equivalent.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designation of the officer for Category/level III submissions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The designated officer for Category/level III submissions is the Director/Deputy Secretary/Under Secretary/Deputy Director or equivalent.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designation of the officer for Category/level IV submissions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The designated officer for Category/level IV submissions is All other levels.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When were the Zones/Wings asked to propose the channel of submission for various items of work?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Zones/Wings were asked to propose the channel of submission in respect of various items of work ensuring four-level of submission, vide office Circular of even number dated 9th February, 2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for officers falling in a particular category/level to put up files?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No officer falling in a particular category/level will put up files to another officer in the same category/level unless explicitly provided.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the officers in the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways advised to follow regarding the channel of submission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All officers in the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways are advised to follow strictly the channel of submission as per annexure for the disposal of work.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of document is this?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This document is a Delhi Gazette Extraordinary.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This document appears to be an order or notification from the Government of the National Capital Territory of Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated 13 September, 2006.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main subject or topic of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document appears to be related to unemployment allowance and employment exchange procedures.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the issuing authority for this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is issued by the Lt. Governor of the National Capital Territory of Delhi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the requirements for applying for the unemployment allowance mentioned in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The applicant must submit a prescribed application form, proof of being a resident of the National Capital Territory of Delhi, proof of date of birth, school leaving certificate, and a certificate of unemployment from the Special Employment Exchange.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How long is the unemployment allowance granted for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The unemployment allowance is granted for a period of one year and can be continued for subsequent years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mode of payment for the unemployment allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The unemployment allowance shall be paid on a quarterly basis in the last month of every quarter.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should the applicant inform the concerned authority about?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The applicant shall inform the concerned authority about any change in their residential address within a period of one month.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for applying for the unemployment allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The applicant must apply to the order of the competent authority, which shall be final.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the unemployment allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Any applicant approved by the order of the competent authority may apply for the unemployment allowance.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What documents are required to be submitted along with the application form?

question_answer_pairs.answer: The applicant must not be placed in any gainful occupation, normally.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: Instructions to all the Judicial Officers in the State of Telangana to use Digital Signature Certificates, to activate and utilize the official Court email IDs for all the official communications.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is dated 25.01.2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number of the circular is Circular No.6/2021.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the circular is to instruct the Judicial Officers and Staff members to use postal service for communications of Letters, Circulars, and Proceedings, to reduce paper work, and to use e-facility services.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction given to the Judicial Officers regarding the use of Digital Signature Certificates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Judicial Officers are instructed to put the Digital Signature Certificates to optimum use, to sign Judgments, Orders and all the Official communications without fail.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many official email IDs have been created for the subordinate courts in the State of Telangana?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the Registry has created 457 official email IDs for all the subordinate courts in the State of Telangana.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction given to the Judicial Officers regarding the use of official email IDs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Judicial Officers are requested to instruct the concerned Court Staff to use the official Court email IDs only for all the official communications.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction given to the Unit Heads regarding the undated cases of their Unit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Unit Heads are directed to take steps to minimize the undated cases in their Unit and also direct the Judicial Officers under their control to verify the physical bundles of cases, which are undated.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Engagement of retired Central Government Employees as consultant in Hindi Division of Ministry of Power - Reg\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many consultants does the Ministry of Power intend to engage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Power intends to engage two Consultants (Official Language).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the responsibilities of the consultants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To assist the Ministry in undertaking comprehensive activities to promote use of Official Language in official work in the Ministry and also to provide assistance in translation of documents, implementation of OL policy and relevant assignments.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for the consultants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Retired Central Government employees who retired from the post of Assistant Director/ Joint Director or equivalent post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit for the consultants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Age should not be more than 65 years on the date of advertisement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the consultants be remunerated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The consultants will be paid a fixed monthly consolidated remuneration arrived at by deducting the basic pension from the pay drawn at the time of retirement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will there be any increment or percentage increase in remuneration during the contract period?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There will be no increment/percentage increase during the contract period.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What allowance will the consultants receive?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No Allowance of any kind would be admissible except TA which should not exceed the rate admissible at the time of retirement.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum leave that can be availed by the consultants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Accumulation of leave beyond a calendar year will not be allowed.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When is the last date to apply for the consultant positions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Applications received thereafter will not be entertained.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where should the applications be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The interested candidates may email their applications to adm2-power@nic.in.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designation of the post for which the consultants are being hired?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Assistant Director/ Joint Director or equivalent post.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the contract for the consultants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The term of the contract is not specified in the circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will the consultants be entitled to Dearness Allowance during the contract period?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Dearness Allowance shall be allowed during the term of contract.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of engaging these consultants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To promote the use of Official Language in official work in the Ministry and provide assistance in translation of documents.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is regarding the filling up of vacancies in various categories in Allahabad Division, North Eastern Railway.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The total number of vacancies mentioned is 4700-08-051-10.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the categories of vacancies mentioned?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The categories mentioned are Assistant Loco Pilot, Goods Guard, Trackman, Pointsman, and Khalasi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum educational qualification required for the vacancies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum educational qualification required is 10+2 or equivalent.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit for the vacancies?
