question_answer_pairs.answer: The validity period of the panel is 2 years from the date of publication of the result.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the medical standard required for the vacancies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The medical standard required is A3 for Assistant Loco Pilot and Goods Guard, and B1 for Trackman, Pointsman, and Khalasi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay scale for the vacancies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay scale is Rs. 19,900-63,200 (Level-2) for Assistant Loco Pilot and Goods Guard, and Rs. 18,000-56,900 (Level-1) for Trackman, Pointsman, and Khalasi.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The probation period is 2 years.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the selection process for the vacancies?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The selection process includes written examination, document verification, and medical examination.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mode of written examination?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The written examination will be conducted in Computer Based Test (CBT) mode.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The syllabus includes General Awareness, Arithmetic, and Reasoning.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The duration of the written examination is 90 minutes.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the marking scheme for the written examination?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The marking scheme is 1 mark for each correct answer and 1/3 mark deduction for each incorrect answer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum qualifying percentage for the written examination?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum qualifying percentage is 35% for UR/EWS and 30% for SC/ST/OBC candidates.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for document verification and medical examination?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The selected candidates will be called for document verification and medical examination as per the merit list.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for final selection?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The final selection will be based on the merit list prepared after the written examination, document verification, and medical examination.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The result will be published on the official website of North Eastern Railway.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The selected candidates will be issued appointment letters and asked to join their respective posts.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Inviting application for filling up various posts on deputation (Foreign Service term basis) in the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI), Regional Office at Ranchi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The UIDAI is an autonomous statutory Authority set up under the Aadhaar (Targeted Delivery of Financial and Other Subsidies, Benefits and Services) Act, 2016.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the post for which applications are invited?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The post for which applications are invited is Assistant Account Officer.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many vacancies are there for the post of Assistant Account Officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The number of vacancies for the post of Assistant Account Officer is 01 (One).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility/qualification criteria for the post of Assistant Account Officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eligibility/qualification criteria include: i) Officers from the Central Government holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre/department, OR with three years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 7, ii) Officers from State Government/ Public Sector Undertaking/ Autonomous Organization holding regular post in corresponding grades with requisite experience, iii) Professional qualifications of Chartered Accountant/Cost Accountant/MBA (Finance), OR Having passed SAS/equivalent examination of organized Accounts Cadre of Central/State Government, OR Having successfully completed Cash & Accounts Training organized by ISTM, OR Having at least five years' experience in handling accounts related work, and iv) Basic skills for working in a computerized office environment.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay matrix level for the post of Assistant Account Officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay matrix level for the post of Assistant Account Officer is -08.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the Regional Office of UIDAI located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Regional Office of UIDAI is located at Ranchi.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the address of the UIDAI Regional Office at Ranchi?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The address of the UIDAI Regional Office at Ranchi is Bangla Sahib Road, Behind Kali Mandir, Gole Market, New Delhi - 110001.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The duration of the deputation/foreign service term is not specified in the circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the multiple approaches that will be used for seeding LPG databases with bank accounts and Aadhaar numbers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Oil Marketing Companies (OMCs) will collect Aadhaar numbers and Bank account details at LPG distributors and through drop boxes at other locations.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the bank account details be captured in the LPG database?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Bank account details (account number + IFSC + name of account holder) will be sent to banks electronically via NPCI and banks will confirm the veracity of the information as per their records. Thereafter, OMCs can seed that bank account information in the LPG database.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two modes of seeding bank accounts in the LPG database that will be implemented by banks/NPCI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two modes are: (a) Bank accounts details captured by OMCs and bank account information (account number + IFSC + name of account holder) will be sent to banks electronically via NPCI and banks will confirm the veracity of the information as per their records. (b) Thereafter, OMCs can seed that bank account information in the LPG database.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will collect the Aadhaar numbers and bank account details at the LPG distributors and drop boxes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Oil Marketing Companies (OMCs) will collect the Aadhaar numbers and Bank account details.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana methodology and data be used in the seeding process?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Bankers could also use the Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana methodology and data collected to assist in the seeding process.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of seeding the LPG database with bank accounts and Aadhaar numbers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to facilitate the re-launch of the Modified Direct Benefit Transfer for LPG Consumers (DBTL) Scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The decision to re-launch the DBTL scheme was taken by the Union Cabinet in its meeting held on 18.10.2014.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The re-launched DBTL scheme will be implemented in the entire country from 1.1.2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to provide information about the revised course curriculum for MEO CLASS III Second Engineer Officer (NCV) - Upto 3000 KW as per STCW 78 as amended in 2010.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number mentioned in the document is STCW 2010 Training Circular No. 20 of 2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the 2010 Manila Amendments to the STCW Convention enter into force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 2010 Manila Amendments to the STCW Convention entered into force on 1st January 2012, as per the document.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the revision of the course curriculum for Marine Engineer Officer - Class III Second Engineer Officer (NCV) based on?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revision of the course curriculum is based on the 2010 amendments to the STCW Convention.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum power limit for the revised course curriculum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revised course curriculum is for Marine Engineer Officer - Class III Second Engineer Officer (NCV) upto 3000 KW.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who was involved in the consultation for the revision of the course curriculum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The revision of the course curriculum was carried out by the DGS in consultation with the maritime training institutes and all the stakeholders.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can the details of the new preparatory course be found?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The details of the new preparatory course can be found in Annexure I.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How is the new preparatory course divided?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The new preparatory course is divided into two parts (Part A of 2 months duration and Part B of months duration).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When can Part A of the new preparatory course be done?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Part A can be done at any stage after getting MEO Class IV NCV CoC.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: When can Part B of the new preparatory course be attended?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Part B can be attended after completion of the required sea service, as per the STCW 2010 Circular No. 18 of 2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is expected from the training institutes regarding these guidelines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is expected that training institutes would follow these guidelines in letter and spirit.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the status of the instructions issued earlier regarding this course?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All instructions issued earlier regarding this course stand withdrawn and the above revised course is to be followed.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this resolution?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Home Affairs (Department of Official Language) issued this resolution.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this resolution?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to encourage the implementation of the Official Language Policy.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What new scheme is being introduced in this resolution?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The new scheme introduced is named \"Rajbhasha Kirti Puraskar\" for the financial year 2015-16.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the categories of offices/institutions that will be honored under this scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The categories are (A) Ministries/Departments, (B) Public Sector Undertakings, (C) Boards/Autonomous Bodies/Trusts etc., and (D) Nationalized Banks.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many shields will be given to each category of offices/institutions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The number of shields to be given for each category is mentioned in the table.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the criteria for awarding the shields to Ministries/Departments?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Ministries where the number of staff is less than 300 will be awarded 03 shields.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is \"Uploading of service area plans on district websites - modification of format\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was enclosed with the letter as per the first paragraph?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter enclosed the format for preparation of Service Area Plans (SAPs).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the second paragraph, what guidelines were referred to for the establishment of Ultra Small Branches?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The guidelines referred to were issued by this Department vide letters No.21/13/2009-FI(PL) dated 28th December, 2011 and 9th February, 2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What campaign was mentioned in the second paragraph?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The \"Swabhimaan\" campaign to villages with population of 1000-2000 in North East and hilly States and to villages that have crossed 2000 population as per 2011 census.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the criteria for FIP villages to be included in the Service Area Plan?
question_answer_pairs.answer: FIP villages in the Service Area Plan should include all villages with population of over 2000 identified under Swabhimaan campaign, as well as other villages as advised vide letter F.No.3/5/2012-FI dated 18.5.2012.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"FI Place/Village\" refer to according to the explanation for Column 2?
question_answer_pairs.answer: FI Place/Village refers to identified place/village/town under the Gram Panchayat, having population of 1000 or more (2001 census) in the States/UTs of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Tripura, Sikkim, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Uttarakhand, Chhattisgarh, Andaman & Nicobar, Daman & Diu, Puducherry and Lakshadweep.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What does \"Identified place/village/town\" refer to according to the explanation for Column 2?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Identified place/village/town under the Gram Panchayat, having population of 1600 or more (2001 census) in other States/UTs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be the format for the \"FI Place/Village\" as per the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The format should be \"FI place/village\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the explanation provided for Column 5 of the format?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Column 5 of the format should read as \"Column No.5\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which states and union territories are mentioned in the explanation for Column 2(a)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Tripura, Sikkim, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir, Uttarakhand, Chhattisgarh, Andaman & Nicobar, Daman & Diu, Puducherry and Lakshadweep.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the population criteria for the \"FI Place/Village\" mentioned in Column 2(a)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The population criteria is 1000 or more (2001 census).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the population criteria for the \"Identified place/village/town\" mentioned in Column 2(b)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The population criteria is 1600 or more (2001 census).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What was enclosed with the letter referred to in the first paragraph?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The format for preparation of Service Area Plans (SAPs) was enclosed with the letter.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Guidelines for Implementation of GIAN\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of GIAN?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Global Initiative for Academic Networks\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the aim of the GIAN program in higher education in India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To tap the talent pool of scientists and entrepreneurs internationally and encourage their engagement with the institutes of Higher Education in India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which institutions are initially included in the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All IITs, IIMs, Central Universities, IISc Bangalore, IISERs, NITs and IIITs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the evolving scheme of the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN program will initially include participation of foreign faculty in Institutes as Distinguished / Adjunct / Visiting faculty / Professors of Practice, etc., to participate in delivering Short or Semester-long Courses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has constituted the GIAN Implementation Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: MHRD has already constituted a GIAN Implementation Committee headed by Secretary (HE), MHRD.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the GIAN Implementation Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN Implementation Committee is tasked to finalize and approve the GIAN implementation through courses and also decide on budget allocation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be the Brand Ambassadors for the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There will be a set of Brand Ambassadors for GIAN consisting of highly eminent academicians who are willing to advise the GIAN programme and project it internationally.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Brand Ambassadors?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Brand Ambassadors will be invited to the GIAN Implementation and will participate as Lead Speakers / Distinguished faculty in GIAN activities. They will also help encourage eminent researchers and scientists to participate in the GIAN programme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What can the Brand Ambassadors do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Brand Ambassadors can also submit special proposals for GIAN activities for approval of the Implementation Committee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many Sectional Committees will be initially formed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There will initially be twelve Sectional Committees.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: In which areas will the Sectional Committees be formed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Sectional Committees will be formed in the following areas: (i) Physical Sciences, (ii) Chemical Sciences, (iii) Biological Sciences, (iv) Mathematical Sciences, (v) Engineering Sciences, (vi) Computer Science and Information Technology, (vii) Earth and Atmospheric Sciences, (viii) Humanities and Social Sciences, (ix) Management Sciences, (x) Medical Sciences, (xi) Veterinary Sciences, and (xii) Pharmaceutical Sciences.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Sectional Committees?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Sectional Committees will receive, shortlist and recommend proposals for various topics under their respective areas.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the Sectional Committees receive proposals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In order to receive, shortlist and recommend proposals for various topics, there will initially be twelve Sectional Committees.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will the Sectional Committees invite to participate in GIAN activities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Sectional Committees will invite eminent researchers and scientists to participate in the GIAN programme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What can the eminent researchers and scientists do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eminent researchers and scientists can also submit special proposals for GIAN activities for approval of the Implementation Committee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the GIAN Implementation Committee in approving proposals?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN Implementation Committee will approve the proposals received from the Sectional Committees for various GIAN activities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the GIAN program be implemented initially?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN program will initially include participation of foreign faculty in Institutes as Distinguished / Adjunct / Visiting faculty / Professors of Practice, etc., to participate in delivering Short or Semester-long Courses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What other activities will be included in the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Other activities will be included in due course.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will decide on the budget allocation for the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN Implementation Committee headed by Secretary (HE), MHRD will decide on the budget allocation.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN program is aimed at tapping the talent pool of scientists and entrepreneurs internationally to encourage their engagement with the institutes of Higher Education in India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the GIAN program catalyze higher education institutions in India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN program is envisaged to catalyse higher education institutions in the country, and it will initially include all IITs, IIMs, Central Universities, IISc Bangalore, IISERs, NITs and IIITs.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Which state universities will the GIAN program subsequently cover?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN program will subsequently cover good State Universities where the spinoff is vast.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the evolving scheme of the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The GIAN program is an evolving scheme which will initially include participation of foreign faculty in Institutes as Distinguished / Adjunct / Visiting faculty / Professors of Practice, etc., to participate in delivering Short or Semester-long Courses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be invited to the GIAN Implementation Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Brand Ambassadors for GIAN, consisting of highly eminent academicians, will be invited to the GIAN Implementation Committee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Brand Ambassadors in the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Brand Ambassadors will advise the GIAN program and project it internationally. They will also participate as Lead Speakers / Distinguished faculty in GIAN activities.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the Brand Ambassadors encourage participation in the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Brand Ambassadors will help encourage eminent researchers and scientists to participate in the GIAN program.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What can the eminent researchers and scientists do in the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eminent researchers and scientists can submit special proposals for GIAN activities for approval of the Implementation Committee.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How many Sectional Committees will be initially formed for the GIAN program?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There will initially be twelve Sectional Committees formed for the GIAN program.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the letter is to derive maximum advantage of the Annual Refresher Programme in Teaching (ARPIT) available on the SWAYAM Platform by the faculty of respective AICTE approved Institutions/Universities through enrollment in various online Training Courses.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is SWAYAM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: SWAYAM is an online platform being used to train teachers through Annual Refresher Programmes.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the objective of the Annual Refresher Programme in Teaching (ARPIT)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The objective of ARPIT is to strengthen the empowerment of the Faculty/Teachers, provide them access to latest developments, familiarize them on the new and emerging trends, and encourage pedagogical improvements and methodologies for transacting the revised curriculum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the 75 discipline-specific National Resource Centres (NRCs) mentioned in the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter mentions that 75 discipline-specific National Resource Centres (NRCs) were notified for implementing ARPIT, and these NRCs are providing online training material with focus on latest developments in the discipline, new & emerging trends, pedagogical improvements and methodologies for transacting the revised curriculum.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the emphasis of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter states that the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India has emphasized on enhancing the professional skills of the higher education faculty under the Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya National Mission on Teachers and Teaching (PMMMNMTT) scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the flexibility of the SWAYAM Portal in terms of annual refresher courses?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter mentions that the SWAYAM Portal is highly flexible, and the annual refresher courses can be done at one's own pace and time. The NRCs will revolutionize the professional development of faculty by catering to massive numbers by leveraging ICT and online technology platform of SWAYAM.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The 75 discipline-specific National Resource Centres (NRCs) are responsible for providing online training material with focus on latest developments in the discipline, new & emerging trends, pedagogical improvements and methodologies for transacting the revised curriculum, as part of implementing ARPIT.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the emphasis of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, on enhancing the professional skills of higher education faculty?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India has emphasized on enhancing the professional skills of the higher education faculty under the Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya National Mission on Teachers and Teaching (PMMMNMTT) scheme.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the flexibility of the SWAYAM Portal benefit the professional development of faculty?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The SWAYAM Portal is highly flexible, and the annual refresher courses can be done at one's own pace and time. The NRCs will revolutionize the professional development of faculty by catering to massive numbers by leveraging ICT and online technology platform of SWAYAM.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the document is Additional Provisions For Standard Advances At Higher Than The Prescribed Rates.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number of the document is RBI/2016-17/282 DBR.No.BP.BC.64/21.04.048/2016-17.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to provide instructions on the provisioning rates prescribed in the Master Circular - Prudential norms on Income Recognition, Asset Classification and Provisioning pertaining to Advances dated July 1, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the regulatory minimum for the provisioning rates mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisioning rates prescribed in the abovementioned circular are the regulatory minimum, and banks are encouraged to make provisions at higher rates.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for banks to make provisions at higher rates?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason for banks to make provisions at higher rates is to ensure that banks have adequate provisions for loans and advances at all times.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first policy that banks shall put in place as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Banks shall put in place a Board-approved policy for making provisions for standard assets at rates higher than the regulatory minimum, based on evaluation of risk and stress in various sectors.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: How often shall the policy mentioned in the previous question be reviewed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The policy shall require a review, at least on a quarterly basis, of the performance of various sectors of the economy to which the bank has an exposure to evaluate the present and emerging risks and stress therein.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What aspects may the review mentioned in the previous question include?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The review may include quantitative and qualitative aspects like debt-equity ratio, interest coverage ratio, profit margins, ratings upgrade to downgrade ratio, sectoral non-performing assets/stressed assets, industry performance and outlook, legal/regulatory issues faced by the sector, etc. The reviews may also include sector specific parameters.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the immediate action required as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: More immediately, as the telecom sector is reporting stressed financial conditions, and presently interest coverage ratio for the sector is less than one, Board of Directors of the banks may review the telecom sector latest by.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the telecom sector's interest coverage ratio mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The telecom sector's interest coverage ratio is less than one.\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is issued by the Department of Banking Regulation, Central Office, Reserve Bank of India.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To inform that State Governments/Union Territory administrations, after identifying the mineral blocks with proven reserves, may apply as project proponent, seeking prior environmental clearance (EC) under the provisions of the Environmental Impact Assessment Notification, 2006\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process mentioned for obtaining prior environmental clearance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The user agency (successful bidder holding Letter of Intent), identified by the States/UTs through the process of auctioning or any other legitimate means, as per the provisions of Clause 11 of EIA Notification, 2006\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision under the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980 mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The existing provisions under the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980 provide for State Governments/Union Territory administrations to apply as user agencies seeking prior approval for use of forest land for non-forestry purposes in respect of identified mineral blocks\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process mentioned for transfer of the said approval as per the relevant provisions under Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980?
question_answer_pairs.answer: After obtaining such approval, State Governments/Union Territory administrations may transfer the said approval as per the relevant provisions under Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980, and Rules & Guidelines made there under, to a new user agency (successful bidder holding Letter of Intent), identified by the States/UTs through the process of auctioning or any other legitimate means\n

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not mention any specific deadline for submitting the compliance through email.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mode of communication mentioned in the circular for the Institutions to submit the compliance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the Institutions should attend the SAC and present the compliance for the deficiencies observed, without fail.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Regional Offices as per the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Regional Offices have been conducting the Scrutiny/EVC and the results have been uploaded on the portal.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the schedule of the SAC attached with the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The schedule of the SAC is attached to inform the Institutions about the date and time of the meeting.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence mentioned in the circular if the Institutions do not attend the SAC meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular does not mention any specific consequence, but states that the Institutions should attend the SAC and present the compliance for the deficiencies observed, without fail.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the communication through email mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that if \"NIL deficiency\" is noted by Scrutiny/EVC, the Institutions need not appear before SAC unless AICTE specifically sends a communication through e-mail to attend the SAC.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Competent Authority mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is issued with the Approval of the Competent Authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to inform about the Standing Appellate Committee (SAC) meeting on 07th April, 2019 in respect of Chapter I of the AICTE Approval Process Handbook 2019-20.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is issued by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is dated 04.04.2019.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the circular is \"Standing Appellate Committee (SAC) on 07th April, 2019 in respect of Chapter I Cases - 2019-20\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the SAC meeting be held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The SAC meeting will be held at AICTE, HQ, Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi - 110070.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What documents are the institutes requested to bring to the SAC meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The institutes are requested to bring 1) Valid authorization letter issued by Chairman / Secretary of the Trust / Society / Company, 2) Photo ID with a copy of it, and 3) All the documents in original and a copy (that are relevant to the compliance of deficiencies observed in respect of your Institution).\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Will the representative be paid any TA/DA for attending the meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, the representative shall not be paid any TA/DA in this regard.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has approved the issuance of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This circular is issued with the Approval of the Competent Authority.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to 1) All concerned Institutions and 2) All Regional Offices.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the schedule of the SAC meeting attached with this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The schedule of the SAC meeting is attached with this circular.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the SAC meeting mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the SAC meeting is to present the compliance for the deficiencies observed therein to the committee on the scheduled date and time, without fail.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The title of the document is \"RESERVE BANK OF INDIA\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of the document is February 26, 2018.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number mentioned is A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 18.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the document addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to \"All Category - I Authorised Dealer banks\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main topic of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main topic is \"Risk Management and Inter-bank Dealings: Revised guidelines relating to participation of a person resident in India and Foreign Portfolio Investor (FPI) in the Exchange Traded Currency Derivatives (ETCD) Market\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What regulations are mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document mentions the \"Foreign Exchange Management (Foreign Exchange Derivative Contracts) Regulations, 2000 dated May 3, 2000\".\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the notification number mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notification number mentioned is FEMA 25/RB-2000 dated May 3, 2000.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What circular number is mentioned as being amended from time to time?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number mentioned as being amended is A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 90 dated March 31, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number related to the participation of a person resident in India in the ETCD market?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number is A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 91 dated March 31, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number related to the participation of a Foreign Portfolio Investor (FPI) in the ETCD market?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number is A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 91 dated March 31, 2015.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the limit for persons resident in India and FPIs to take a long (bought) or short (sold) position in USD-INR without having to establish existence of underlying exposure?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The limit is upto USD 15 million per exchange.\n

question_answer_pairs.question: What other positions are persons resident in India and FPIs allowed to take?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They are allowed to take long or short positions in EUR-INR, GBP-INR and JPY-INR pairs, all put together.\n
